Really, particularly, boring. Combat hasn't evolved at all since Diablo 3. It is 100% still a game where you die if you stand in a ground explosion and otherwise nothing else matters. The MMO component means the aspirational upper Torment levels have been totally removed, so you trivialize almost all content within the first day of playing, leaving nothing but Rifts/"The Pit".  Just kind of a miserable and meaningless feeling game. You will regret spending both your time and money once you realize how thin and trivial it all is. Do not buy even on sale.

As an older keyboard/mouse RPG gamer, love ARPGs like the original Diablo, D2, Titan Quest, Grim Dawn, Last Epoch, and some non-ARPGs like Borderlands, Fallout 3+, Elder Scrolls, etc.  Well I've played D4 enough now to say that I find it to be an outstanding ARPG.  I got only the base game while it was on sale, so I can't say anything about the DLC.  But I've sure gotten my money's worth out of this game and plan to continue playing it.  I'm not one to concern myself with trying to get the very best gear, grind for an item, etc.  In D4 so far, I always seem to be finding solid items that I have to review to determine if they will upgrade my build.  When they do, I equip them, temper them, socket them, etc. and then continue on my way.  Blizzard did an excellent job of dropping loot that makes you want to pick it up and then compare it against what you're using, level by level.  The pace of level progression has been great as well so far.  As for the action, the feel of my Barbarian is excellent.. the audio effects are better than in other ARPGs I've played in the past.  The environments are excellent as well.  No bugs at least on my system so far (7600X, 32gb DDR5 6000, RX 9060XT 16gb build).  All in all, I think this is a game definitely worth buying if you were on the fence like I was after reading reviews from others.  It's too good of a game to pass up, especially if you're into ARPGs.  That's my review.

Don't touch the latest Season. The idea of Sanctified items might sound sort of great. But in truth they're a soft-lock trap. They will replace critical affixes to your character with ones that aren't even close. For example, a 300% masterwork affix to trap damage. Replaced with a 9.2% to poison damage. The sanctified affix is base level and doesn't match the masterwork level of the item. It's a trap. Don't touch it. Wait until the next expansion for any good content.

😈 Sarcastically Venomous Review: Diablo 4 The game that proves the real hell isn’t full of demons — it’s full of cooldown timers, empty fields, and loot with worse stats than your starter gear.  “Dark atmosphere” so dark it hides the fun too Yes, Diablo 4 is dark. So dark that: colors gave up lighting filed for bankruptcy joy packed its bags and left Sanctuary entirely It’s like playing inside a damp sock someone dropped in a dungeon.  An open world so empty you can hear your own boredom echo Open world? More like open wasteland. You’ll spend: 5 minutes running to the next icon 10 minutes realizing it’s the same event you did 14 times 20 minutes questioning your life choices It’s the first ARPG that doubles as a meditation app.  Combat that’s fun… until you realize you’re doing the same thing forever Early game: “Wow, this feels great.” Mid game: “Okay, still good.” Late game: Click. Dodge. Click. Dodge. Loot. Realize loot is trash. Repeat until spiritually numb. Your fingers develop muscle memory. Your soul develops regret.  Lilith: an amazing villain trapped in a story afraid to be interesting Lilith is incredible — elegant, terrifying, magnetic. And the story around her? A series of errands disguised as epic quests. “Go here. Kill that. Listen to monologue. Go somewhere else. Kill the same thing again.” It’s like the writers were scared of their own plot.  Loot system designed by someone who hates joy Diablo 4 showers you with loot. Unfortunately, 99% of it is: weaker uglier or has affixes that make sense only if you’re a demon accountant Legendary drop? Congrats. It probably rolled “+2% damage while standing on one foot during a lunar eclipse.”  Endgame so repetitive it becomes a spiritual practice Nightmare dungeons. Helltides. World bosses. Repeat until your brain becomes smooth like a polished health potion. It’s not endgame — it’s endurance training.  Class balance that feels like a cosmic joke One class is a god. One class is a meme. One class is fun until Blizzard nerfs it into the Shadow Realm. Balance patches arrive like prophecies: unpredictable and usually bad news.  And of course… the battle pass Because nothing says “dark gothic demon‑slaying adventure” like a premium cosmetic shop. Want a cool armor set? Pay. Want a horse that doesn’t look depressed? Pay. Want dignity? Sorry, that’s not in the shop rotation.

From what I can tell the bad reviews have to be for expansion costs and maybe in-game purchases as well, and yeah, I would agree that's not a positive for the game's name. As a game, though, this is same ole Diablo fun with great graphics, extremely immersive dark fantasy (which really attracts me as a fan of Berserk and such), and action rpg gameplay that you can have a wild time with. I didn't buy this game intending to spend any extra money on nonsense, and I have been having a heck of a good time 10 hours in anyway. Is it a little jarring to see a game like Diablo kind-of Activisionized with Battle-Pass stuff, sure, but going into it without even paying attention to those things is still an amazing time. Recommended for sure, like holy cow it is fun!

Diablo IV entrega exatamente o que promete: um ARPG sólido, sombrio e viciante. A ambientação é um dos pontos mais fortes — o tom mais adulto e a direção de arte puxada para o dark fantasy resgatam bem a essência da franquia.  O combate é fluido, impactante e satisfatório. Cada classe tem identidade clara, builds variadas e sensação real de progressão. O jogo te recompensa o tempo todo por experimentar e otimizar o personagem.  A campanha é bem escrita, com destaque absoluto para a Lilith, uma das melhores antagonistas da série. O mundo aberto funciona bem, não é vazio, e as atividades extras mantêm o loop interessante mesmo após o fim da história.  No endgame, há bastante conteúdo, especialmente para quem gosta de grind e evolução constante. Ainda há ajustes a serem feitos (balanceamento, QoL), mas o suporte contínuo deixa claro que o jogo está em evolução.  Não é perfeito, mas é um Diablo de verdade. Se você curte ARPG, progressão, loot e atmosfera pesada, vale muito a pena.

Близы отлично скамят, продали длс, потом взяли и бесплатно его раздали, следующее длс получается тоже раздаст длс с паладином? Отличный прогрев, я больше не поведусь, зря на старте возврат не оформил. Интереснее всего что многие пытаются защитить игру выставив как пример систему продаж в WoW, Destiny 2 и других подобных играх сервисах которые буквально наживаются на игроках путём стирания контента/превращения в бесплатный и т.д. (возможно в апреле действительно выйдет отдельная продажа длс). При этом люди забывают о адекватных играх наподобие The Division 1/2 (и прочие игры по вселенной Tom Clancys), Warframe, Helldivers, Monster Hunter и прочих где выход новых длс или развитие/изменения сюжета не обесценивает предыдущий контент, такие вещи как продажи с большей скидкой за меньше чем месяц до ввода этого обновления в состав следующего выглядит не очень, они таким образом буквально дойдут до того что в следующем длс заставят нас снова покупать саму диабло 4 повторно, просто чтобы срубить денег.

像笑话一样的无聊游戏。  让我们从商店介绍页面看一看这款搞笑的游戏——  -- 欢迎来到地狱     没错，你的游玩体验和亲身来到地狱没什么区别；鉴于暗黑四的画面表现力，实在又表现不出来玩家身处于环境的地狱，甚至非和谐版也没什么值得和谐的内容，比起路边任何一个奇幻rpg都平淡。佛法云：“譬如有人，在世间平常屋舍中，却受烈火焚身之苦，无有间断”，即是如此。  -- 广阔的开放世界     “广阔”吗？这个游戏不同的地图有什么区别呢？不如说有好几款不同花纹的抹布拼在一起，玩家扮演一滴油渍蠕动穿梭于如同ai生成的随机地图中，抱歉您加载时也要读条，恕我直言我真不记得这个游戏里任何的地图场景了，我上小学的外甥涂鸦都比这种地图有创意。  -- 沉浸式的角色养成     “在强大的技能树上不断投入”？这些技能的枯燥程度很难让我想象现在已经是2025年了，技能的加成也就是做一些被动效果的小buff，限于手柄等因素一共就那么几个技能，让我感觉圣骑士、德鲁伊们即使到了终局还没有学徒出道。感谢暴雪的设计师为了玩家们的快餐体验和上手轻松，让角色们保持一种童真式的美好与幼稚，每个职业甚至有二十种主动技能可供选择！  -- 传奇装备，史诗战斗     “发现并利用数量庞大的强力武器”，确实数量很庞大，但是都没有用处。我不觉得垃圾装备过多是问题，而把时间投入到反复刷这些无用的装备上，我也不觉得这是什么用传奇装备进行史诗战斗的伟大游戏，更像是用刚好命中的随机数种子完成了除了数字的膨胀外毫无特点的无聊工作，快继续尝试赌到自己想要的词条吧，在此之前你将毫无提升。  -- 终局游戏的无尽追求     没错，在追求无尽征途中，除了敌人的血量和自己的伤害在增加，没有任何变化，哦，还有层数的数字。如果是这样的游戏体验，那不叫“无尽追求”，而是叫无尽折磨。当然，我们可以选择点击退出游戏，让我们体验地球online其他的可能性，包括给这款《暗黑破坏神4》一个理所应当的差评。  而暗黑四最无聊的就是就算bd成型了也除了输出的数字提升以外也没有什么快感，把伤害数字的单位从千、千万换成亿、兆又有什么意思呢，技能、装备、特效的联动仅在数值有所体现，抛去跳动的伤害数字以外基本没有差异，不如给一个提供自定义伤害的修改mod，可以取代后期除pvp的所有内容。如果说不去追求最强角色而放弃这份痛苦，难道这个游戏还任何好玩的点吗？很难说这个游戏的游戏性比那些小龙虾型网游有强处，只能说它的缺点较为纯粹保证了游玩的下限。  至于定价等其他问题就不考虑了，出于尊重的角度我只先批评游戏本身的毫无意义感，在我愿意给出评价的游戏里很难有如此折磨又无聊的游戏，我称之为一种剪切时间的方式。  奶茶用果汁和奶包装了它热量炸弹的本质，而薯片却写清了自己就是个垃圾食品，暗黑四就像是一罐包装精美而又毫无营养的薯片，我欣赏它的诚实。

One of the most tedious, excruciating, and boring ames I have ever played, at least in the ARPG genre. An affront to the first two entries in the series. One of its only upsides is the visual design of some areas—the temples in the Dry Steppes, for instance—especially after the bafflingly cartoony previous entry, but the uninspired level design often makes it moot. Blizzard clearly does not care about the campaign (it's so mindlessly easy that it's insulting), and considering I couldn't give a rat's ass about 'endgame content,' I only struggle through the acts because of sunk cost.

Diablo IV, c’est un ARPG qui fait exactement ce qu’on lui demande : on clique, tout explose, et on se sent bien. Le gameplay est solide, les classes sont fun à jouer et la campagne (ainsi que le DLC) est vraiment agréable, avec une ambiance sombre et des cinématiques super propres. C’est parfait pour se défouler après le boulot ou pour une petite session de farm sans prise de tête. Maintenant, soyons honnêtes : la profondeur des builds est limitée, les saisons qui reset ton perso tous les trois mois peuvent être frustrantes, et la monétisation est… disons “dans l’air du temps”. Si vous cherchez un endgame ultra‑complexe façon Path of Exile, passez votre chemin. Mais si vous aimez Diablo, que vous voulez une aventure fun, un bon gameplay et un univers qui claque, Diablo IV fait le job. Pas le meilleur ARPG du marché, mais un très bon moment quand on sait ce qu’on vient y chercher.

Rating: 6 / 10. The game started very strong with the storyline, but became very boring, very quickly. I've stopped playing after reaching chapter 3.  The CONS: i) There's to many side quest which aren't memorable. ii) You level up WAY to fast. There's nothing to look forward to after reaching level 60 (which you reach in the first chaper). iii) The Paragon system is dumb. iv) You get over spoiled with unique drops. You become so strong that the game becomes a walking simulator where monster die before they can touch you. v) Greed!! I've paid to unlock the extra options to grind / unlock the cosmetics, which costs around half the price of the base game. When the season resets after 90 days, you pay the same amount agin. THAT was the final nail in the coffin for me.  The PRO's: i) The game is nice to play if you only have 20 minutes available a day. ii) It's easy to uninstall.  This would be a good game if it was from a Indie developer, not from a AAA+ developer.  Buy this game & expansion on a 60% sale, if you want to play it.

BUYS WHEN  30$ or less.  So far it does some minor things better than Diablo 3 Already Owned cosmetics dont cost 40k gold every time you change its free. D4 Gems: You can now salavage them into "Dust" and recraft them into higher quality gems. You can now craft various potions from the herbs harvested in the regions. At blacksmith you now have an otpions to salvage all gear in your inv, options to either favorite your gear or marks as junk, Fav your gear keeps it from being salvaged and "marks as junk" tells the systems to salvage it regardless of rairty type making it less tedious. Gems are now placed in theri own iventory sections which frees upspace for your gear.   Jewler you can add socket if you have enough materials  and you dont need to farm those Ramladis cube things nor enchant the gear to have sockets   When salvaging a legendary with a new Unique Propety , you unlock that unqiue property after salvage and apply to another armor piece so now no need to waste valuable resources form upgrade and reforge rare and Legendary  item to hopefully get something good.  Also Rifts, Obols(D4 Blood Shards) come with base game

⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5 – Muy recomendado)  🎨 Gráficos — ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5) Visualmente el juego está excelente. Los escenarios, efectos y diseños están muy bien logrados y se siente un nivel de detalle alto en todo momento. Es de esos juegos que entrás y decís “ok, esto se ve muy bien”.  🕹️ Jugabilidad — ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5) Para alguien nuevo en los ARPG, la jugabilidad es muy accesible. Los controles son claros, el combate se siente fluido y no abruma con sistemas complejos desde el inicio. Ideal para quienes quieren meterse en el género sin frustrarse.  📈 Progresión y aprendizaje — ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5) El juego explica bien sus mecánicas y te va llevando de a poco. No necesitás experiencia previa para disfrutarlo, aunque a medida que avanzás empieza a pedir más tiempo y dedicación.  🔁 Contenido y misiones — ⭐⭐⭐☆ (3/5) El punto más flojo. En sesiones cortas, algunas misiones secundarias pueden volverse repetitivas, lo que puede sentirse pesado si no tenés muchas horas disponibles para jugar.  ⏱️ Duración y dedicación — ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5) No es un juego para jugar de a ratos. Para disfrutarlo de verdad hay que meterle horas, pero si te enganchás, se pasan bastante rápido.  ✅ Conclusión Un juego muy entretenido, visualmente impecable y amigable para nuevos jugadores del género. Tiene algunos detalles mejorables en la variedad de misiones, pero en líneas generales es una experiencia muy sólida.  Lo recomiendo, especialmente si estás empezando en los ARPG.

🎮 Análise – Nota: 10 Minha jornada nos RPGs começou na infância, marcada por um grande amigo e verdadeiro ícone nesse gênero: Jadson Mariele. Foi ele quem me apresentou a um universo que mudaria minha vida para sempre. Eu tinha apenas 10 ou 11 anos quando ele me mostrou um game fenomenal: With Your Destiny (WYD), e logo depois os lendários Diablo I e II. Jadson não apenas jogava, ele zerava e compartilhava comigo todo o conhecimento que adquiria. Graças a ele, descobri a magia dos RPGs e desenvolvi uma paixão que carrego até hoje. Nossa amizade continua firme, e posso dizer sem exagero: ele é um cara fenomenal, um verdadeiro irmão de jornada. Essa história pessoal me conecta diretamente ao que vivemos agora com Diablo IV. E que jogo! Um título emblemático, épico e inesquecível, que honra o legado da franquia e entrega uma campanha de tirar o fôlego.  💎 Recomendação Se você ama RPG, pode mergulhar sem medo. Eu comprei na promoção por R$137,00 e afirmo: valeu cada centavo. A experiência é tão intensa e apaixonante que não há como dar outra nota senão 10/10.  ✨ Em resumo: minha infância foi marcada por WYD e Diablo, minha amizade foi fortalecida por esse universo, e hoje, com Diablo IV, sinto que tudo se conecta em uma obra-prima que merece ser celebrada.  Classes de Diablo 4 em Detalhes:  1. Bárbaro - Estilo de jogo: Guerreiro corpo a corpo, focado em força bruta. - Habilidades principais: Uso de várias armas simultaneamente, gritos de guerra que fortalecem aliados ou enfraquecem inimigos. - Diferencial: Sistema de Arsenal, permitindo trocar entre armas para diferentes habilidades. - Ideal para: Jogadores que gostam de combate direto e resistência alta.  2. Feiticeiro (Sorcerer) - Estilo de jogo: Mago elemental, especialista em ataques à distância. - Habilidades principais: Magias de fogo, gelo e relâmpago. - Diferencial: Sistema de Encantamento, que permite transformar habilidades em efeitos passivos adicionais. - Ideal para: Jogadores que preferem controle de campo e explosões de dano mágico.  3. Renegado (Rogue) - Estilo de jogo: Versátil, podendo lutar corpo a corpo ou à distância. - Habilidades principais: Arcos, adagas, armadilhas e venenos. - Diferencial: Escolha de especialização entre Combo Points, Shadow Realm ou Exploit Weakness. - Ideal para: Jogadores que gostam de mobilidade, furtividade e flexibilidade.  4. Necromante - Estilo de jogo: Mestre da morte, invocador de servos. - Habilidades principais: Invocação de esqueletos, golems e manipulação de cadáveres. - Diferencial: Sistema de Livro dos Mortos, que permite personalizar os tipos de servos invocados. - Ideal para: Jogadores que gostam de controlar exércitos e usar magias sombrias.  5. Druida O meu favorito amo ele de paixão recomendo muito o mesmo - Estilo de jogo: Transformação e manipulação da natureza. - Habilidades principais: Mudança de forma (urso, lobo), magias de vento e terra. - Diferencial: Alterna entre formas animais e conjurações naturais para se adaptar ao combate. - Ideal para: Jogadores que gostam de versatilidade e conexão com a natureza.  6. Spiritborn (Classe adicionada em expansão) - Estilo de jogo: Guerreiro espiritual, inspirado em culturas tribais. - Habilidades principais: Uso de espíritos ancestrais, ataques místicos e rituais. - Diferencial: Sistema de Spirit Attunement, que permite alinhar-se com diferentes espíritos para ganhar poderes únicos. - Ideal para: Jogadores que buscam uma experiência nova e temática, com forte ligação espiritual.   - São 6 classes no total em Diablo 4. No Game Base - Cada uma atende a diferentes estilos de jogo: do combate direto do Bárbaro ao controle mágico do Feiticeiro, passando pela versatilidade do Druida e pela invocação do Necromante. - A escolha depende do seu gosto: ação bruta, magia, furtividade, invocação, versatilidade ou espiritualidade.   A campanha de Diablo IV gira em torno da ascensão de Lilith, a “Filha do Ódio”, que retorna ao mundo de Santuário para manipular e dominar os mortais. É uma narrativa sombria, cheia de dilemas morais, que mistura ação épica com temas de fé, corrupção e sobrevivência.  🌑 Contexto da História - Ambientação: O jogo se passa em Santuário, um mundo devastado após os eventos de Diablo III. A humanidade está enfraquecida, e demônios e cultos aproveitam o caos. - Antagonista principal: Lilith, filha de Mephisto, é invocada de volta ao mundo. Diferente de outros demônios, ela não busca apenas destruição, mas sim manipulação e domínio psicológico. - Tom narrativo: Mais sombrio e maduro que os anteriores, com forte inspiração em terror gótico e dilemas religiosos.  📖 Estrutura da Campanha - Ato I – Fraturas no Norte: O jogador começa em Fractured Peaks, descobrindo os primeiros cultos que seguem Lilith e testemunhando sua influência sobre os humanos. - Ato II – Deserto de Kehjistan: A trama se aprofunda com revelações sobre a criação de Santuário e o papel de Lilith e Inarius (anjo rebelde que também busca poder). - Ato III – Dry Steppes: Conflitos tribais e a expansão da corrupção demoníaca mostram como Lilith manipula diferentes povos. - Ato IV – Hawezar: O jogador confronta cultos mais poderosos e descobre os planos finais de Lilith. - Ato V – Conclusão: O clímax envolve batalhas épicas contra forças demoníacas e a resolução do destino de Lilith e Inarius, deixando ganchos para futuras expansões.  🎭 Temas Centrais - Livre-arbítrio vs. manipulação: Lilith promete liberdade, mas na prática escraviza mentes e corações. - Religião e fé: A Igreja de Inarius tenta controlar os fiéis, mas sua moralidade é questionável. - Humanidade em crise: O jogo mostra como pessoas comuns são seduzidas pelo poder em tempos de desespero.  🔥 Por que a campanha é tão marcante? - Personagens complexos: Lilith não é apenas vilã; ela é carismática e manipuladora, tornando o conflito mais psicológico. - Atmosfera: Cenários sombrios, trilha sonora intensa e narrativa cinematográfica criam imersão. - Continuidade: A história conecta elementos clássicos da franquia, mas abre espaço para novas expansões e personagens.  📌 Conclusão Você tem razão em dizer que é um fenômeno: Diablo IV conseguiu entregar uma campanha épica, madura e emocional, que não só honra a tradição da franquia como também eleva o nível da narrativa. É uma experiência que mistura ação visceral com profundidade filosófica — e por isso tantos jogadores, como você, se apaixonaram pela história.   Personagem da Campanha:  Os principais personagens da campanha de Diablo IV são Lilith, Inarius, Neyrelle e Lorath, cada um representando forças e dilemas diferentes que moldam o destino de Santuário. Lilith é a vilã carismática, Inarius o anjo fanático, Neyrelle a jovem aprendiz que carrega o peso da escolha, e Lorath o mentor cético e experiente.  🌑 Lilith – A Filha do Ódio - Origem: Filha de Mephisto, um dos Três Grandes Demônios. - Papel: Principal antagonista da campanha. Ela retorna a Santuário com a promessa de libertar a humanidade, mas na prática manipula e subjuga. - Características: Carismática, manipuladora e complexa. Não é apenas destrutiva, mas sedutora, oferecendo poder e esperança em tempos de desespero. - Impacto: Sua presença cria dilemas morais, pois muitos humanos acreditam em sua visão de liberdade. ⚔️ Inarius – O Anjo Rebelde - Origem: Um arcanjo que abandonou os Céus. - Papel: Fundador da Igreja de Inarius, que controla os fiéis em Santuário. - Características: Fanático, obcecado por ordem e poder. Se vê como salvador, mas sua tirania rivaliza com a manipulação de Lilith. - Impacto: Representa o lado angelical corrompido, mostrando que nem os anjos são puramente bons.  🌟 Neyrelle – A Aprendiz - Origem: Jovem estudiosa que acompanha o jogador e Lorath. - Papel: Personagem central na jornada, curiosa e determinada. Aprende sobre magia e sobre os horrores do mundo. - Características: Ingênua no início, mas cresce em importância. Sua relação com o jogador é emocional e decisiva. - Impacto: No final da campanha, toma uma decisão cru

Boy oh boy... I regret wasting my money so I want to inform others. I won't cover every detail but I'll cover the ones that are more important IMO. In short, it's just not fun and it's predatory and they make you pay upfront for the game then separate for every DLC which you need if you actually play the game and if you don't want to use the free gear that looks like diarrhea on a canvas compared to the paid cosmetics you best not be too attached to your savings. after paying the full price for the game you constantly have to keep buying DLCs so you can actually play the game and if you do want the cool cosmetics you better be real rich cuz they are not pulling punches with these HILIARIOUS prices. There is no love put into this and you can feel that this is just developed to make money. There are random disconnects, the gameplay is spammy (I actually like spam if there is something fun about it) but it's not in a fun way you, just spam abilities on cooldown people even use macros for them, it's clear all their budget has gone into their cosmetics. You could buy a house with the amount of money you need to get all the cosmetics in the game and they do look sick and it's sad to see how much effort is put into cosmetics with their bonkers prices where each costs the price of a AAA game and there are so many cosmetics and none of that budget is allocated towards developing the actual gameplay or fixing the issues. They don't listen to play your feedback. You're still clearing out garbage from your inventory half the playtime. Nothing feels unique or fun, abilities, forms, animations, enemies, no improvement since D3... It's all *hit button and do a little AoE and spam again when it's shortly back on cooldown*, you would think would different forms and classes and shape-shifting etc things could feel diverse but everything feels the same and monotonous. I watched a lot of videos and for end game you are forced to play the same FEW boring builds as others, you don't get to be creative or make fun builds and actually be able to make progress. Same issues as D3 but with less charm and more issues, very unwelcoming to new players too unless you don't mind grinding dozens of times less efficiently than optimal and are forced to use countless outside sources to know what to find out whats going on. Quests are poorly designed and BORING, like very few games have quests THIS bad...It's without soul and you feel it. RIP the loved franchise. I've wasted my money and I'm done pretending Diablo can be fun again. Whether you are new to Diablo or a returning player I strongly do not recommend it, it is pure soulless cash grab and it feels like a chore to grind, I encouraged my friend to try it with me and he played with me once and never touched it again and I can understand why Even though we've both been craving a Co-Op action RPG badly. This is cash grab but without the fun as bait, just luring people in with its name and fame. Don't waste your money. I'm not saying there's no one who can enjoy this game I'm sure there is but I'm also sure for most it's extremely unlikely they won't regret buying this game. If you are the type who likes to grind everything whether it be new content or cosmetics you better be an actual whale with a bottomless bank account and enjoy soulless extremely repetitive gameplay. Imagine if their greed wasn't literally infinite and they used the budget for the actual game and listened to feedback instead of pocketing the money and using the rest for over the top cutscenes and cosmetics so they can have cool looking trailers and cosmetics to make people empty their wallets aside from the DLCs? Nah blasphemy

Steam Review: Diablo IV Hours Played: 403 on Steam, 290 on Xbox Relationship Status: It’s complicated, but I keep coming back Recommended: Like a cursed ring with great stats, yes, but it hurts  I love this game. No really, I love this game. It’s my digital obsession. My pixelated passion. My demon-slaying soulmate. But also? Diablo IV makes me feel like the side chick at a microtransaction wedding.  The combat? Smooth like hell-butter. The classes? Chef’s kiss (Necro mains rise up, but Sorcerer when I’m feeling spicy). The world? Dark. Brutal. Beautiful. There’s nothing like wandering through the blood-soaked fields of Scosglen at 3am questioning your life and skill build.  But here’s where it hurts...  💸 The DLC Situation  Come on, Diablo. You already have me for nearly 700 hours across two platforms. Do I really need to pay extra for premium mounts, armor sets that look like concept art I’ll never wear, and the illusion of belonging to Season 5?  It’s like being in a long-term relationship and still getting charged for dinner. I already gave you my time. My soul. My social life. And now you want $25 for a pack of cosmetics I’ll look at once before going back to transmogs from Season 1?  😢 The Sad Truth  The gameplay loop is glorious, but it’s also the kind of grind that whispers “just one more dungeon” until your blood sugar drops and your loved ones forget your voice. You’ll hit highs, epic drops, elite boss wipes, that one perfect Ancestral roll. But you’ll also hit lows, like realizing your build is outdated, the Season theme isn’t clicking, or you just spent 3 weeks grinding a character you abandon for something shinier.  Still…  I come back. Because when it works, when it really works, it’s gaming ecstasy. You feel powerful, efficient, mythic. Like the loot gods themselves are proud of you.  Final Verdict:  Diablo IV is a phenomenal game buried beneath a cash shop trying to cosplay as a content roadmap. The core experience? Dark magic. The monetization? Darker still.  10/10 when I’m playing. 6/10 when I’m thinking. 12/10 when the loot drops are hot and I forget all my complaints.  Would play again. Will complain again. Still waiting for a hug from Blizzard, not another bundle.

I've played much, much longer than my shown time here, but on Battle.net. Steam, though, seems more stable, and doesn't launch Battle.net app, which is a plus. So I recommend D4 through Steam as opposed to Battle.net. As for the game itself: in Season 11 it's better than in the past, but it's hard to tell if they're able to keep it up, since update cadence is slower and less impactful than PoE/PoE2 for example.  Unfortunately, D4 is littered with bugs, especially with notorious memory leak bug which wasn't fixed since like August 2025. Game often disconnects and loading screen can last forver, or lead to disconnection too (and I'm not the only one who had that problem: streamers have the same problem all the time). Literally, D4 has the same issues with connection, latency, and stability as D3 had/has, I don't understand why they were unable to fix that since then.

Diablo IV – Hirn aus, Loot an  Was soll man über Diablo IV noch sagen? Es ist genau das Spiel, zu dem man greift, wenn man das Gehirn ausschalten will, um sich durch tausende Gegner zu schnetzeln, bis der gesamte Bildschirm in Explosionen, Schadenszahlen und Effekten untergeht – und man dann plötzlich tot ist, weil irgendwo im Chaos noch eine feindliche Explosion mitlief. Klassisches Diablo-Feeling eben.  Es gibt mehrere Klassen, und jede davon lässt sich in unterschiedliche Richtungen ausprägen. Ob eher defensiv, als Glaskanone oder mit Fokus auf bestimmte Skills und Synergien – die Build-Vielfalt ist solide und motiviert zum Ausprobieren. Spätestens im Endgame verliert man sich dann in einer Vielzahl an Aktivitäten: zig Dungeons, Events und andere Beschäftigungen sorgen dafür, dass einem rein mechanisch kaum der Stoff ausgeht.  Ein großes Highlight ist die Story. Sie ist sehr hochwertig inszeniert, atmosphärisch dicht und deutlich ernster als in früheren Teilen. Die Zwischensequenzen und das Worldbuilding machen Lust auf mehr und gehören klar zu den größten Pluspunkten von Diablo IV.  Doch es gibt auch deutliche Schattenseiten. Die Spielwelt ist Always-Online und als Open World konzipiert. Dadurch trifft man ständig auf andere Spieler, was zwar belebt wirkt, aber die immersive Singleplayer-Erfahrung zerstört. Man ist nicht mehr der eine Auserwählte, sondern nur noch einer von vielen, die zufällig gerade dasselbe Gebiet abfarmen.  Auch die Nebenquests sind eher gut gemeint als wirklich gut gemacht. Sie erzählen zwar kleine Geschichten, sind spielerisch aber selten interessant oder vielseitig genug, um nachhaltig zu fesseln. Dazu kommt das problematische Gegner-Spawn-System: Mobs erscheinen und respawnen ständig und scheinbar zufällig. Ein echtes Fortschrittsgefühl oder das Gefühl, ein Gebiet „gesäubert“ zu haben, stellt sich kaum ein – und Erkunden verliert dadurch stark an Reiz.  Beim Loot sieht es ähnlich aus. Gefühlt kann jeder Mob alles droppen, abgesehen von ein paar speziellen Bossen. Da man sein Gear ohnehin ständig austauscht, fehlt oft das Gefühl, auf ein bestimmtes Item gezielt hinzuarbeiten. Zwar gibt es viele Optionen zum Min-Maxen und Optimieren, doch die Tiefe eines Path of Exile erreicht Diablo IV bei Weitem nicht.  Unterm Strich gilt: Wer ein vergleichsweise einfaches, zugängliches und trotzdem unaufhaltsam grindiges Action-RPG sucht, bei dem es vor allem um Explosionen, Loot und Dauerbeschallung geht, ist bei Diablo IV genau richtig. Wer hingegen Tiefe, langfristige Progression und eine wirklich immersive Einzelspieler-Erfahrung erwartet, wird eher ernüchtert zurückbleiben.

A bit bummed by this game. UX is not up to an AAA game. In solo mode you have to be connected: therefore you can be thrown out of the server at any time, you can't use mods, and above all you can't pause the game! It's incredibly inconvenient. Other hack'n'slash games have proper solo modes, why not this one? Had to give up a level 30 character because of the silly "skip campaign" option you can trigger on the character selection screen if you're not careful. No confirmation request, no move back. Why, Blizzard, why? Other than that the game is visually impressive, story and gameplay are ok, dance of knives the best skill ever.  Edit : 70€ for a DLC ? Lmao keep it

Мы с братом Назифом возвращались в лагерь после похода в древний храм, полный сокровищ и тайн. В зале подземелья два могучих демона не хотели уступать нам легендарное место силы — они слишком медленно отступили, и мы их мастерски подрезали умелыми ударами, заставив их реветь от ярости, истекая магической энергией. Вся остальная нечисть, как испуганное стадо монстров, сгрудилась в дальнем углу зала и даже боялась поднять на нас глаза. Правда, один старый седой воин тьмы, увешанный проклятыми амулетами и рунами, наверное, древний страж, попытался что-то проворчать, но брат Назиф швырнул его на пол, и мы долго молотили его мощными способностями, пока он не пал, испуская вспышки тёмной крови на свои трофеи. Когда волна закончилась, вся нечисть в панике разбежалась по коридорам, а мы с братом спокойно дошли до безопасной зоны, швыряя в входящих демонов трофейными амулетами и рунами с павшего стража. Diablo IV — эпическая игра, полная адреналина и братских подвигов! Glory to the Nephalem!!!

我是自童年时于与表哥一起游玩暗黑三入坑这个系列的，作为一名零零后，偶尔不时感到可惜，没有生在那个所有游戏争相开发游戏玩法的时代， 没来得及品味那时的游戏氛围与社区，没来得及游玩mmo鼎盛时期的mmo网游。就像看小说，看一本已知完本，和你一直随时间推移追一本正在更新，不知结局在何处的小说完全不一样。         很多人或许已经厌倦了大型网游，毕竟多数人的生活中已经没有这么多时间留给那些游戏了，但我却连体验，沉浸的机会都不曾有过。留给现在的，似乎只剩大家风卷残云后的满地尘埃，还有那些打着mmo幌子的古风换装游戏。无数新游戏打着老ip的名头，在游戏界进行着换皮，消费着情怀，却没有继承任何那独属于老IP的开拓精神。         暗黑四与暗黑三的跨度，仿若暗黑三与暗黑二之间的跨度，说实话中间挺多赛季也挺史的，那破罗盘不提也罢。但这赛季感受到了一丝过去的味道，地精地下城，尤其是听说还有奶牛关的消息还有彩蛋，这一次的推荐，我承认情怀依旧占了很大比重，但起码4现在是一个适中能玩的游戏了

The game is generally fun in moderation. A few hours at the start of each seasons is okay. Endgame content and class design is typical of Blizzard games from the past decade, namely D3 and WoW. Every class is builder-spender oriented and you go around the world to complete activities to gear up, then progress through The Pit/ Greater Rifts/ Mythic+ for endgame. It is a gameplay loop that can be entertaining, but it is soured by Blizzard's rampant monetization.   The battle pass and skin store are not a good thing for a game like this. In no world does it make sense to spend 20+ on a skin for a character that is hardly even visible. The skins themselves are an acquired taste. Very mobile game-esque if that's what you want to spend money on.  There is no shortage of opportunities to spend money, however. $30-50 for the base game. Another $40 every few years for the expansions. Another $10+ or so for battle passes. All of this for a game that can never be fixed. I am certainly convinced that Blizzard is purposely crippling the game to trickle in positive changes every season in hopes of drawing players back in. It seems every season that Blizzard "finally fixes the loot system", only for complaints to continue in subsequent seasons.
Love it!

[h1]There is strong gameplay at least[/h1]  Attacks have impact and feel powerful. The loot and skills system are nicely done. There is a lot of content to discover but it's slowed down by its story. Personally I did not like the story direction Blizzard took with Diablo 4 as they went and made the gore the main attraction, instead of the dark gritty mood of Diablo 2, PoE2 and to some extent Last Epoch.  Also the voice acting is mostly bad and feels unbelievable. Thankfully you can skip the story and just play the game, I would suggest you do that when you create a new character.  Unfortunately they failed to fully capture the essence of Diablo. Still they managed to make a nice attempt at an Action RPG game.  [b]Recommended[/b]

With recently hitting 2.500 hours in this game, I can easy say that this is one of my favorite games ever. I started playing it back in 2023 after the release of the 2nd season.   I liked it instantly. This is not my first diablo game, the first one being Diablo Immortal.   What instantly surprised me the first time I logged into this game was the art style and the soundtrack which both I call masterpieces. I loke the soundtrack so much that I listen to it occasionally while I'm at work.  The story while not the greatest, it is good enough, with you having to fight different lesser evils like, Andariel, Asmodan, Duriel etc.   In the beginning, the end game content was insufficient but with time and new expansions, it got  much better than initially.   I personally like endless hours of grinding for better and better gear.   It's not the best game but in my opinion it a really bloody good one and I love it!  10/10 for me.

Explorar mais regiões tropicais e suas estéticas é outro grande acerto da expansão do jogo, acompanhando uma nova classe que também se integra a esta estética tropical, entra na tendência de vários jogos de explorar diferentes culturas e ambientações baseadas no mundo real.

I’ve been playing Diablo since I was 11, starting with the very first game. I played an absurd amount of Diablo II, which remains one of my favorite games of all time. Diablo III had a very rough launch, but over time it evolved into an excellent “Gauntlet-style” ARPG that I truly enjoyed. I love this franchise. I really do.  Now, Diablo IV.I genuinely feel sorry for the artists, programmers, musicians, and everyone involved on the creative side of the project. Their work is undermined by the people calling the shots at a higher level: those responsible for the gameplay direction, progression systems, and monetization strategy. Diablo IV is clearly designed around battle passes, cosmetic shops, endless checklists and artificial engagement systems that have no place in a Diablo game.  Cosmetics make your character look as if this were World of Warcraft. In a Diablo game, your character is supposed to look powerful and unique because of the gear you earn, not because of something you bought. Instead of meaningful progression, the game bombards you with infinite objectives, challenges, and to-do lists that feel more like a shopping list than an RPG. The result is a game built to retain players, not to challenge or inspire them.  I bought the game when they announced the Paladin. The Crusader was one of my favorite classes in Diablo III, and I had an absolute blast with it. Seeing how similar the Paladin looked and played I decided to jump in. Since Diablo IV is an open-world game, you’re encouraged to do side quests, roam the map, and engage with small time-limited activities like world events (those red zones on the map with waves of enemies), alongside Nightmare Dungeons and other scattered content.  By the time my character hit level 50, I was only halfway through the campaign. I reached level 60 early during the final act.  I literally one or two-shot every boss in the game. Every single one. That includes Lilith, both phase 1 and Phase 2. I have no idea what these bosses actually do, what their mechanics are, or what their movesets look like because they die before any of that matters. The story itself was painfully boring (also, a Diablo game without Diablo?), and the in-game cutscenes felt cheap and underwhelming. There are maybe two proper cinematics that resemble the classic Blizzard quality (those that hype you up like Diablo II or Diablo III).   I finished the campaign with seven Uniques, and the rest of my inventory was Legendaries. White, blue, and yellow items were completely worthless. Legendary items are so common that calling them “legendary” is laughable. Uniques drop so frequently that I already had duplicates. So much for being unique.  After finishing the campaign, I kept pushing the difficulty, hoping the game would eventually reach a point where enemies could survive more than one or two hits. I made it halfway into Torment II, running Pit levels around 30–35. Here, Belial could take more than two hits.  But here’s the problem: whenever I died, it was always for one of two reasons. Either I got instantly deleted by one-shot mechanics (constant ground explosions and overlapping AoEs flooding the Pit) or Belial landed an attack that turned my health bar yellow and drained it to zero over time with no meaningful counterplay. This is incredibly lazy game design. The game throws endless waves of identical mobs at you. There are no memorable enemies, no distinctive encounters, nothing. The world is visually beautiful, yet completely hollow.  Everything feels the same. The entire game exists to stroke your ego and tries to make you feel like an unstoppable god, without ever earning it. I walked from point A to point B for over 30 hours, pushing through the campaign and endgame content, waiting for the game to finally open up or become interesting at higher difficulties. It never does. There is nothing there. Literally nothing.  Seeing all that art, all that polish, it’s heartbreaking. What an absolute waste of talent. Blizzard truly deserves every ounce of hate it gets.  Path of Exile 2 and Diablo II Resurrected completely blow this game out of the water.

Diablo IV é um jogo que impressiona à primeira vista pelo visual, pela atmosfera sombria bem construída e pelo retorno a um tom mais sério, algo que muitos fãs pediam desde Diablo III. No entanto, passada a empolgação inicial, fica difícil ignorar a sensação de que o jogo é cru, pouco lapidado e, sobretudo, mal aproveitado em termos de profundidade e conteúdo a longo prazo.  O problema se agrava quando se observa a política de preços. Diablo IV já é extremamente caro em sua versão base e, ainda assim, entrega uma experiência que depende fortemente de atualizações sazonais e expansões para se manter relevante. As DLCs seguem a mesma lógica: preços estupidamentes altos para conteúdos que, muitas vezes, parecem mais correções e complementos do que verdadeiras expansões robustas.  A situação atinge um nível quase cínico com a expansão Lord of Hatred. A Blizzard simplesmente incluiu a DLC Vessel of Hatred dentro dessa nova expansão, sem qualquer tipo de desconto ou compensação para quem já havia comprado o conteúdo anteriormente. A mensagem é clara: se você comprou antes, parabéns, você não ganha absolutamente nada por isso. Foi passado para trás pelo verdadeiro Lord of Greed, a própria Blizzard.  No fim, Diablo IV acaba sendo um exemplo de como uma base sólida e um nome forte podem ser minados por decisões comerciais agressivas, que afastam justamente quem mais queria acreditar no jogo.

Ich spiele Diablo nun schon seit sehr langer Zeit, und kaum ein anderes Spiel hat mich über so viele Jahre hinweg derart fesseln können. Die düstere Atmosphäre, der unverwechselbare Soundtrack und das tiefgehende Gameplay sind einfach zeitlos. Jede Klasse fühlt sich einzigartig an, das Loot-System motiviert dauerhaft und der ständige Fortschritt sorgt immer wieder für diesen einen Moment: „Nur noch eine Runde.“  Besonders beeindruckend ist, wie sich Diablo im Laufe der Jahre weiterentwickelt hat, ohne seinen Kern zu verlieren. Egal ob alleine oder im Multiplayer – das Spiel schafft es immer wieder, mich in seine dunkle Welt hineinzuziehen. Die Kämpfe fühlen sich wuchtig und befriedigend an, und die Story sowie das Worldbuilding sind bis heute außergewöhnlich stark.  Für mich ist Diablo nicht nur ein Spiel, sondern ein Stück Gaming-Geschichte, zu dem ich immer wieder gerne zurückkehre. Absolute Empfehlung für alle, die Action-RPGs lieben – egal ob Neueinsteiger oder Veteranen.

Много лет играл в ВоВ покупал обновления и вот решил поиграть в эту замечательную игру после ПОЕ2. Подумал что было бы круто играть в дьяблу на стим деке. Купил, скачал и стал связывать стим аккаунт с аккаунтом батл нет и это видимо было моей ошибкой. Стим дек не в режиме рабочего стола имеет немного кривой браузер из за чего я сам себя заспамил кодами подтверждения. И на следующий день получил письмо счастья от близарда о том что акаунт забанен и они просят ДОКАЗАТЬ МЕНЯ ЧТО МЕНЯ ВЗЛОМАЛИ.  И тут начинается веселый круг сансары. Восстановить аккаунт можно через официальный сайт, чтобы написать тикет надо войти в акаунт, а он заблокирован. Можно попытаться разблокировать аккаунт с подтверждением через почту, но даже так в аккаунт войти нельзя. В итоге чтобы разблокировать акаунт надо залогиниться, а залогиниться я не могу так как аккаунт заблокирован.  Я конечно попытаюсь восстановить акк, но если не получиться надеюсь на рефаунд.   Не советую запускать эту игру в первый раз через стим дек  P.S. Спустя неделю удалось разбанить аккаунт. Близард признали ошубку, сказав, что меня заблокировали по ошибке

Vale a pena na promoção, mas não espere profundidade.  Comprei Diablo 4 na promoção justamente por ouvir muitas reclamações sobre o preço cheio, e infelizmente, as críticas têm fundamento. O jogo entrega uma diversão casual e momentânea, mas falha em quase todo o resto que importa num ARPG.  Dificuldade Inexistente: A campanha até chegar ao endgame é triste de tão fácil. O jogo praticamente se joga sozinho; você não precisa pensar ou ter estratégia para zerar.  História e Quests: A narrativa principal é rasa e as missões secundárias (side quests) parecem encheção de linguiça, oferecendo recompensas que não valem o tempo investido.  Builds e Progressão: Embora dê para montar algumas builds divertidas, o jogo não estimula a criatividade. O sistema te empurra para um ciclo infinito de "farm, farm e farm" apenas por números maiores, sem mecânicas interessantes.  Enfim, foi levemente divertido enquanto durou, mas a sensação de repetição chega rápido demais. Zerei, vi o que tinha para ver e, honestamente, não pretendo abrir o jogo novamente por uns bons anos. Só compre se estiver muito barato e você quiser desligar o cérebro.

The first PC game i have played around the age of 8 was Diablo 1 on my 66Mhz Intel Pentium 486. I own physical copy of Diablo 2+LOD that i've played for thousands of hours as a teenager. I've played lot less Diablo 3 due to work but also got my wife into playing Diablo 3. Reaper of souls made it almost perfect in every way. The Diablo series is the most played game of my life and for good reason. Diablo 4 is a completely different experience. The game has outstanding visuals that hides the only goal the developers had in mind: try to get you addicted with the simple and fluid gameplay hoping you will fall victim to the in game shop. They removed and monetized one of the core gameplay incentives of the genre which is grinding for epic loot that looks epic and showcases your hours invested in the game. Now you can just buy the looks for the price of a full game. They removed set items completely just so they can sell them as overpriced cosmetics while what you can find in-game are nowhere as cool looking. That is insane and unacceptable. Before wearing cool stuff meant you've played a lot. Now it means you have money. The open world is fine but there are no memorable areas you want to return to. There are no memorable boss fights you talk about with your friends. I liked this version of Andariel but the presentation is so poor she just appears in front of you from nowhere through a fog after an awkward cutscene. Lilith fight was somewhat exciting but too short and easy. World bosses look cool but even Azmodan is somehow disapointing. I've kept increasing the difficult but Penitent and above was locked until ive finished the boring placeholder campaign. The game overall feels unrewarding and offers zero challenge. The skill tree is so basic they could have just made a single button for each of the very few intended builds. They of course copied the Rift runs from Diablo 3 but the game is so boring and unrewarding and so obviously just a money trap I just don't care. The campaign is so bad and low budget low effort its shameful for the director. The story of Inarius and Lilith itself is a great idea. Could have been the best storytelling making D4 the most memorable of the series. They've missed the opportunity making D4 a generic forgettable ARPG.

I enjoy the game for what it is. YES the microtransaction sucks and are HELLA expensive, BUT you don't have to buy them. the armor and transmog in the game itself are still pretty cool. I miss Diablo 3 but I'm happy with the changes they did in Diablo 4. I will probably try to 100% achievement this game but for now its a fun grind and farm with small and big goals with mountains of content, not to mention future DLC's coming soon. Overall I recommend it.

I have 1000s of hours on POE and other ARPGs, this was my first diablo game.  I wish I could give this a 'neutral' review.  @@@Things this game does better than POE:  Storytelling and worldbuilding: the story is well-told and actually engaging, with great voice acting and full on cutscenes. Diablo's lore and grimdark aesthetics are great.   Presenting information in-game: The game is great at providing players with information in a simple way. For example when you enchant an item you can press a button to see all the affixes it can roll. You can also hover over a lot of materials and key items to see where they drop and what they are used for, without the need to look in an external website for info.  SSF focus: You can target farm basically everything in the game by cycling through different types of content, this encourages players to engage with the end-game fully.  @@@@ Things this game does worse than POE:  Blizzard's control obsession: You have a cap to how many of each material you can pick up, a cap to a lot of stats, a cap to stash space and a million other caps. They are all too low and seem practically designed to make the game less fun.  Trade: Crafted on an item? It's account-bound now, mythic unique items are always-account bound. The game has no in-built trade-system like the one in POE, but has a trade chat channel. This game is in a weird limbo where it doesn't know if it wants to be a trade or solo self-found ARPG, which ends up making it less enjoyable in both departments.  MICROTRANSACTIONS: Holy hell, the greed in this game compared to POE almost made me give this a negative review.  You pay for the game, you pay for expansions, and STILL you get pressured into buying cosmetic microtransactions and a battle-pass from the get-go. You can't even open your character's wardrobe without seeing 'locked' shop-only skins taking up space. The shop skins are also comically overpriced and only apply to one class.  The free season challenge rewards give you a few weapon skins, a mount-armor skin and recolor, a very basic portal skin, a pet, and a glove skin. If you choose to spend the 200 platinum (shop currency) that the free pass gives you, you get a few extra weapon skins and a basic-looking boot skin.  The rest of the seasonal armor-set skins for your character, and all the high-quality mounts and portal are locked behind the paid pass. In POE, you usually get a full character armor-set skin, and a combination of pets, high-quality portal skins, back attachments etc. all for free (and that's a FREE game). Blizzard's stinginess in comparison is unbelievable.   In my opinion, at the very least there should be cosmetic rewards for pushing the pit really high, or PVP challenges or something gameplay focused, that doesn't just involve swiping your card and giving them money.  CONCLUSION:  Overall, I can't bring myself to give this a negative review, the end game systems work well together and satisfied me as an ARPG fan, the story is well-presented and interesting. The current seasonal mechanic (sanctification) is fun and I hope it stays.  I just wish the devs were actually in charge of this game, instead of the MTX department.

I bough the game and finished the campaign on the Battle.net launcher because i don't trust blizzard to handle account syncing and binding at all, the sheer incompetence on display in the game is terrifying enough.  but here's a review anyway after stockholming myself for aproximately 32 hours.  TLDR: with current competition being what it is, it's not worth the money, it's a flustered attempt to exist alongside more successfull ARPG's and i could point to any ARPG, even older Diablo games that are more fulfilling then this one. watch the story online if you're interested, the gameplay is too bland and forced to recommend it.  first hours : The first couple hours are miserable, there is no variety or fun choices that spark the mind. you go around with the most boring ability like "sweep" or "attack target" and just kill things, then you get a second ability which hopefully can attack multiple targets at the same time and third which hopefully lets you do more damage with your resource, and pray you like the feel of any of them, you peruse the skill tree and every ability sounds boring, and their upgrades or augments are equally boring and underwhelming. the first 32 levels are so sh*t because most of your power comes from gear and commons and blues are completely pointless, yellows are good for base stat items which you can turn into legendaries, once you get to legendaries you can start focusing on whatever you happen to find and discover what you really wanna do.  Story : initially this is what drew me to purchase the game on sale recently, i knew of lilith and i knew of the first cutscene they show you in the church, that premise sold me, a villain that blurs the lines between good and evil, both sides have strong reasons for being trusted or betrayed. however in the actual game you are a mere passenger to these moral quandries, you don't get a choice, you don't get to choose who to side with, in fact any musing you might do about what could have been is frustratingly shut down by moronic characters that you meet, intentionally lobotomized because they have to grow and become a cartoonish adventuring party. plot conveniences are rampant in this game, things happen for no reason, or reasons that were never setup so you get blindsided by another obstacle for no apparent reason. there were a few good moments between the old guy and the fat old guy, but the fat old guy alone is a complete moronic mess of a character. they call the girl a child, but she never came off as such because you meet her roaming about a monster infested land all on her own, i'm sure the story disregards that every 10 feet you can find a group of monsters that will kill you on sight. i'm also sad to say that while lilith is an interesting character she is not the main villain, they talk about her like she is, but she gets far less screentime then the soyboy that follows her around, elias and he has one of the most anti-climactic deaths i've ever witnessed in a video game. right at the end there's also some giant lore dumps and details that sound important but nobody ever mentions them ever again, like how a demon and an angel had a baby and that was never explained or mentioned before or after that.  The story campaign objectives are also completely cookie cutter, there are an insane amount of occassions where one character goes off and you have to "survive the ambush" for a couple of minutes while dialogue plays, or "go and get me this from here and come back" type objectives, this really is a problem throughout the game but it's so lazy in the campaign, it's just there to extend the running time of the game.  gameplay : as i said before it starts out horrible, it gets more bearable once you start getting legendaries that augment skills in more interesting ways, ways i feel should have been reserved for the skill tree. but anything to keep you playing and grinding for random drops amirite. Then there's the "difficulty" system which some could interpret as "this is curated experience by the developers design" but it actually doesn't mean that at all, it's basically world tier, enemies do get more difficult but hard doesn't stay hard if you have full legendary armor, in fact the hardest difficulty you get to play in the base campaign feels like normal by the time you're done with it, this was really confusing to me because it breaks common naming conventions.  My experience joining this late into this live service game was also pretty cheap, as my world was filled with events that leveled me up way too fast and gave me far too much loot if i did them, some campaign missions were so easy it was insane, and then the open world monsters just wouldn't die and came in hoards.  Enemies : this game has a poor variety of enemies, not really but it spreads them out terribly, first you fight red guys, then you fight goats, then you fight the red guys but they're blue this time, then you fight red guys but they zap, then it's skeletons, then it's dogs, then it's skeletons and then it's red ghosts, then skeletons, then blue ghosts, then snakes, then zombies and skeletons, then red ghosts again, and then red guys for a while again, it really gave me destiny vibes where they have 3 archetypes of enemies and just cycle over and over and over, Path of exile has a far better enemy variety and that's FREE ! Elites and rare mobs are also really boring, they are like the normal guys except they have the capacity to give you a seizure, if you get a pack of mobs with blue or yellow mobs that have the right augments they will fill up your screen with crap so dense i'm surprised my GPU didn't just stop working. there were times i lost my mouse pointer because there were swords above my head, green swords flying all over the place, red crap on the floor and mobs the size of my entire screen walking around and shouting at me. Bosses are also completely underwhelming in this game, like end of the dungeons or MAIN campaign KEY bosses. there's a lot of circles on the floor attacks, little balls you have to avoid or kill the ads moments. it really reminds of World of Warcraft. the actual boss does nothing interesting really.  Overall : in the end the campaign dragged on too long, lorath was a fun character but that's about it and the game has such poor variety in RPG and story aspects. in fact i struggle to call this an RPG at all, and so much power being locked behind gear that randomly drops is annoying. menu's are terrible and laggy due to it always being online and the endgame is partially locked behind the DLC which means you need to purchase the latest DLC even when it's not out yet which is far too expensive if you include the fact they are selling costumes in the ingame shop for like 16-24 bucks. i don't feel like i got my money's worth even with the small amount of fun i had.

[h3]Analise do Ponto de Vista de um Player de Diablo Old[/h3]  Bom, comprei o jogo por que ele estava em uma promoção boa de final de ano e ja tinha um pouco de interesse pelo jogo pq ja tinha jogado os anteriores, principalmente o 3 q foi nele q eu descobri minha paixão por diablo, eu ja sabia de todas as criticas e rixa da fan base de Path of Exile 2 com a do Diablo 4,  Comprei o jogo sem nenhuma expectativa por eles terem mudado um pouco do foco do jogo comparado aos anteriores, mas o jogo e muito bom ele entrega a experiencia q vc espera da franquia diablo, MAS, tem um grande detalhe se vc jogou o Diablo 3, se vc lembra da qualidade incrivel das cinematics e cutscines do 3, pode ter certeza q vai se decepcionar com as do Diablo 4 elas sao horriveis parecendo as vezes ate de jogo mobile, a historia e bem fraca comparada a do Diablo 3 tbm da pra ver q ela foi feita nas coxas mas uma coisa q ainda se mantem a qualidade incrivel e a dublagem.  Dito tudo isso recomendo o jogo para pessoas q nunca jogaram diablo antes ou players de diablo q n se importam tanto com criticas e querem testar com suas proprias maos para saber se gosta do jogo ou nao.  [h3]Recomendo[/h3]

Diablo IV m’a appris une chose : je n’ai toujours aucune pitié pour les démons, même en 2025.  Direction artistique magnifique, ambiance sombre à souhait, gameplay jouissif… on sent le retour à une identité plus mature. Chaque session “juste 30 minutes” se transforme mystérieusement en plusieurs heures.  Quelques défauts existent, mais rien qui empêche de s’amuser. Un très bon Diablo qui mérite largement le détour.

The campaign, atmosphere, music, and cutscenes are genuinely excellent - cinematic storytelling inside an ARPG is still rare, and Blizzard absolutely nailed it. The classes are well designed, the combat is satisfying, and there is a huge variety of things to do while leveling and exploring.  The Paragon system is a bit tedious, but that’s fine - it’s clearly meant for people who want to push endgame optimization, not for casual play.  And that’s where the problem starts.  Once you enter the endgame, the game turns into an RNG casino with no real progression. Instead of working toward upgrades, you gamble endlessly: runes, crafting, rerolls, and upgrades all rely on layers of randomness with no guaranteed progress. You can grind for days and get absolutely nothing that moves your build forward. Difficulty doesn’t scale in a meaningful way either - most enemies are trivial, until you randomly get one-shot by specific mechanics. It stops being about skill or planning and becomes about rolling better dice.  Loot also becomes busywork. You pick up endless legendaries not because they’re meaningful, but because they are materials for upgrades. There’s no loot filter, no auto-salvage, and no way to focus on what actually matters. The chance of getting a decent item for your build feels extremely low, and even when you do, the process isn’t over. You have to temper it (randomly change a stat), then masterwork it (randomly upgrade stats and add bonuses), then sanctify it (add a prefix that can be either extremely powerful or completely useless). You can’t reroll sanctification, so when an item gets ruined, the only option is to go back to grinding and start the whole slot-machine process again.  And of course, the monetization: If you don’t want your character to look like a farmer with a pitchfork, expect to pay around $40 for cosmetics. The default mounts and skins are intentionally dull compared to what’s sold in the store.  Hopefully Blizzard fixes some of these issues in the upcoming DLC. For now, I’d only recommend buying it on discount.

大概在《命运1》那会儿，有队友拉我玩《暗黑3》说很好玩，当时我对暗黑系列还有一种“一刀999”的廉价滤镜于是没尝试。 后来到了《命运2》，又被邀请了几次，因为从主机转到PC战网了于是尝试了一下，当时也还是《暗黑3》进去完全是被朋友带飞完全没体验到好玩的地方，玩了两天也就不玩了。 前段时间又被以前一起玩《命运2》的朋友推荐，因为实在游戏荒就买了《暗黑4》，结果... ——超级好玩！  这次深入地体验了《暗黑4》的系统，说实话解开了我长久以来的困扰：为什么《命运》和《全境封锁》总是做一些南辕北辙的设计？原来是在复刻《暗黑》的模式。 我举个例子：不管是《命运1》还是《命运2》，装备都是会随着版本作废的，就是字面意思直接变成废品，一般的手法就是锁死装备的光等上限。矛盾的是《命运》的终局玩法的一大侧重点在Raid也就是突袭，而Raid在Bungie眼里是需要六个人、懂机制、考输出的模式，问题在于《命运》是一款FPS游戏，那打Raid就不仅是需要找到五个队友——哪怕强力的终局装备无法单人获取这点本身就匪夷所思，一队六人还必须懂点机制，Raid的机制还不是那种益智级别的小考验，往往是需要你“在限时内不死的情况下做一系列动手又动脑的考核”。如果你觉得我说得不对，那我确实不算大神，但带过不少新人从零开始打通Raid，《命运1》的每个Raid我都担任过指挥，指挥过不止一队不止一次，机制可以说是滚瓜烂熟（当然这么多年不玩已经忘了很多）。 我认为《命运》系列的Raid难度高是基于以上我的个人经验，《命运1》的Raid难度相对《命运2》比较低的情况下我往往会身兼多职来回跑几个位置确认队友没有出错，很多人会犯错就证明了Raid的难度高，实话说每一次过关我都有一种运气好的感觉。 回想起来，“运气好”这种感觉是匪夷所思的——一个装备会“过期”的刷子游戏里怎么可以频繁出现这种感觉？大家花了大力气刷到的Raid装备，居然转头就会作废？我假设你的驾照三个月过期一次需要重新考试，你怎么想？那为什么公司可以要求大家每天签到？因为签到很简单！！！考驾照没那么简单！！！就是这么回事！！！ ！！！所以！！！ 《命运》和《全境封锁》其实就是《暗黑》这样的“概率游戏”！！！装备合格了之后刷取的过程应该是轻松的！！！这样每个赛季要求重新刷大家才不会觉得累！！！ 隔壁《Warframe》就懂了自己的定位，把早期的神殿钥匙改成了开核桃，谁都能轻松刷取终局装备，所以人家熬死了《命运1》和《全境封锁1》，甚至我看要把《命运2》也熬死。  《暗黑4》非常好玩，因为它就是《命运》和《全境封锁》本该有的样子，除了好不容易通关Raid那一刻的喜悦，其它任何你在《命运》和《全境封锁》里能获得的快乐，《暗黑4》都能加倍给你。 说白了《命运2》和《全境封锁2》现在还有一口气，老玩家还是乐意上线，无非是美术、音乐和剧本的功劳，因为你喜欢枪械就会想玩《全境封锁》而不是《暗黑破坏神》——美术设计决定的。而《命运》据我所知Bungie早就失去了一些艺术设计方面的核心成员，而当艺术这块“口香糖”也被咀嚼得没了香味，那刷子游戏只能拼刷取体验，那《命运》就完全不如《暗黑破坏神》了。  通篇在讲《命运》，其实是对《命运》的肯定，但现在怒其不争。《命运》系列陪伴了我十一年，而现在我觉得《命运》系列挣扎了十一年却还没有搞懂系列的方向，到头来还不如一开始模仿的对象《暗黑破坏神》，Bungie时不时想让《命运》变得精细，重复刷装的模式无论是Strike还是后来的赛季棉花本，总是删了又改，每次尝试都小心翼翼不敢让玩家在这些副本里获得最好的装备，好装备总是要你组队，组队组队组队，哪来那么多朋友天天陪你刷？难度又使得找野人就容易遇到暴躁的。 到头来，《暗黑4》这样一个人也能玩，一个人也能畅游终局的刷子游戏是最舒适最健康的。 PS：《命运2》我退坑好几个月了，听说这个赛季变好了，不敢回坑再观望观望。

Diablo IV pulled me in way faster than I expected. I went in with a lot of questions and curiosity, and in a short time, the game taught me its systems without overwhelming me. Learning builds, skills, and progression felt natural, not forced. As someone who was actively trying to understand how Diablo really works, this felt great.  The combat is smooth and satisfying, and the dark atmosphere does a great job of keeping you locked in. I liked how the game slowly opens itself up — at first you experiment, then suddenly you realize you actually understand what you’re doing. That moment hits nice and makes you want to push further.  Sure, the endgame has its repetitive sides, but the core gameplay loop is strong enough to keep things engaging. I found myself improving, making better decisions, and feeling more confident with the mechanics in a surprisingly short time.  If you enjoy dark ARPGs and like the feeling of growing into the game instead of being thrown into chaos, Diablo IV is a solid choice.

It’s better than it was, but it’s still a waste of time and money.  Blizzard clearly can’t find its footing with ARPGs. The current state of Diablo 4 floods the player with trash loot, while the gameplay itself is brain-numbingly easy. Everything boils down to a simple win/lose check: compare your item level to the content and the outcome is decided. Skill, tactics, and decision-making have almost no impact.  This season leans heavily on corpse explosions and stacking underground tremors. Playing Hardcore finally introduces a small amount of tension, but not in a good way. Death often comes from unavoidable effects rather than player mistakes. The only real “counterplay” is staying in constant motion, because standing still frequently means instant death. That’s mildly amusing for about fifteen minutes.  It’s definitely not worth the sticker price. If you find it at a truly insane discount, you might squeeze a few hours of entertainment out of it. Otherwise, don’t invest in it.

TLDR;  Diablo IV offers atmosphere and production value, but shallow systems, repetitive seasonal design, and aggressive monetization prevent it from becoming a meaningful ARPG. What remains is a functional product that prioritizes revenue over depth, coherence, and long-term engagement.   1. Functionality --- - Largely stable overall - Occasional crashes likely related to memory leaks (mostly on desktop) - Runs well on Steam Deck OLED - Performance of recent seasons is difficult to evaluate consistently   2. Coherence --- - Strong, dark atmosphere and a large world to explore - Story starts promising but collapses toward the end, losing coherence - Skill and Paragon systems are shallow, mostly incremental stat boosts - Loot suffers as a result: modifiers rarely change how classes actually play - Seasons feel like asset re-use rather than substantial content, focused on minor seasonal tuning for specific builds - DLC repeats the same problems: -- a new class with superficial skills -- weak storytelling -- limited content for the asking price   3. Expression --- - Initial polish fades quickly - The game settles into mediocrity: functional, but rarely engaging - Gameplay is simple and becomes monotonous fast - Systems feel designed primarily for monetization rather than: -- player creativity (build depth) -- intrinsic motivation (e.g. meaningful challenge rewards) - Instead: -- low-value Season Pass -- overpriced cosmetics -- shallow seasonal content - DLC builds on these same foundations - Aggressively tuned for casual play - Minor personal gripes: -- weapon-independent animations -- weapons lacking distinct identity -- heavily constrained build variety   Note: No clear public communication was provided regarding discounts or compensation for owners of previous paid DLC. Withholding monetarily relevant information undermines informed consent and damages trust.

As of right now, I haven't entered endgame content, so this review might change later, depending, but for what I have played, it's very fun (if perhaps a bit easy in campaign mode if you're playing coop).  As for complaints, there is one major one, and it really is a MAJOR one... and it's not about the newest DLC giving out the previous for free (games have been doing that for eons, this isn't new- it's a marketing strategy, guys).  The shop is insanely predatory, and blatantly, intentionally so. Whereas most games would just have a shop where you can see everything available at once, this game's shop is on a random, rotating timer, designed to cultivate FOMO. The only upside is that it's entirely cosmetic items, and no random "buy this for 2000 platinum to earn more exp or get better loot!" sales.  For me, it's easy enough to just not engage in microtransactions at all to begin with, so my review is still positive despite this. However, I can absolutely see why this would drive someone to a negative review, and if you're someone who tends to struggle with FOMO or impulse purchases, either stay away from the shop, or stay away from the game entirely, for the sake of your wallet (because they're ALSO all extremely overpriced).

There comes a moment in every life when the world contracts. When the once-vast hours collapse inward, drawn tight by the gravity of something small, warm, and impossibly fragile. After my first child was born, time, like so many false gods, proved fickle.  Friends, who once gathered nightly at the altar of shared availability, drifted away into other schedules, other priorities, other lives. There was no malice in it. Only distance. Only silence.  And in that silence, Diablo IV waited.  Not eagerly. Not loudly. It did not demand I return, nor punish me for absence. Like some ancient, patient thing beneath the surface of the world, it simply was. Sanctuary does not care when you arrive, only that you do.  Each time I returned, often tired, often fragmented, the game opened itself with a familiarity that felt almost… knowing. The wind still howled across the Fractured Peaks. The cathedrals still loomed, solemn and uncaring. The darkness had not paused in my absence, yet neither had it left me behind. I could step into it for an hour, sometimes less, and the world would accept me without question. No schedules to appease. No social contracts to renegotiate. Only blood, ash, and purpose.  There is something quietly merciful in that.  Diablo IV understands solitude, not the romantic kind, but the real, adult solitude that arrives unannounced, wrapped in responsibility. Its world is oppressive, yes, but also strangely companionable. The horror is not there to shock, but to accompany. Lilith’s whisper feels less like a threat and more like a reminder: you are not alone in your suffering; it is simply part of the shape of things.  Where once camaraderie came from voices in a headset, now it comes from the rhythm of combat, the certainty of systems that do not change just because your life has. The loot still falls. The skills still grow. Progress, however incremental, remains possible. In a season of life where so much feels stalled or surrendered, that matters more than it should.  This is not a game that celebrates triumph. It endures. And in doing so, it offers a strange comfort: the knowledge that something vast and indifferent will still make room for you, even when others cannot.  Diablo IV is not your friend. It is something older. And it will be there when you return. As it was for me.

Diablo IV representa um retorno às raízes mais sombrias da franquia, combinando o clima pesado de Diablo II com sistemas modernos de RPG e um mundo aberto que dá mais liberdade ao jogador. O resultado é uma experiência brutal, atmosférica e extremamente viciante.  A ambientação é um dos maiores destaques. Santuário nunca esteve tão sombrio e opressor: cenários macabros, trilha sonora discreta e uma direção de arte que reforça constantemente a sensação de desespero. A história é bem conduzida, com foco em personagens fortes, especialmente Lilith, que se firma como uma antagonista marcante e cheia de presença.  O gameplay segue a fórmula clássica da série: combates rápidos, habilidades impactantes e aquele loop viciante de matar, lootear e evoluir. Cada classe tem identidade própria, com estilos bem distintos de jogo, e a progressão do personagem é profunda o suficiente para manter o interesse por muitas horas. O sistema de builds permite experimentação, mesmo que em alguns momentos se torne um pouco engessado no endgame.  O mundo aberto traz eventos dinâmicos, masmorras e atividades paralelas que ajudam a variar o ritmo, embora algumas acabem se tornando repetitivas com o tempo. Ainda assim, o jogo se sustenta muito bem pela qualidade do combate, pela atmosfera e pela sensação constante de evolução.  No geral, Diablo IV é uma experiência sólida e envolvente, que respeita o legado da franquia e ao mesmo tempo moderniza sua estrutura para uma nova geração.  Nota pessoal: 8,5/10. Recomendado para quem curte ARPGs, loot infinito e um clima sombrio bem trabalhado.

시즌11 첫 입문. 시즌 핵앤슬 장르 첫 입문작입니다.   장점  - 핵앤슬 중에서도 독보적인 그래픽과 시네마틱 - 100% 한국어 음성더빙 - 학살하는 쾌감과 성장하는 재미를 잘 살림  단점  - 뇌 빼고 만든 오픈월드 - 양심 없이 만든 BM - 와이파이 환경에선 감당 안되는 서버렉  옛날에 디아2, 디아3(시즌제 도입 전) 재밌게 즐기다가 접은 유저입니다. 디아4는 초기에 악평이 워낙 많았는데다, 전작인 디아3가 스케일만 대책없이 키워놓고 디아블로 시리즈 특유의 신비하고 음산한 분위기 다 조진 작품이다보니, 후속작 흥미가 떨어져서 4가 나와도 안 샀었습니다. 거기다 옛날 핵앤슬은 난이도별로 캠페인을 다 밀어야 상위 난이도가 해금되는 방식이라 시간을 어마어마하게 잡아먹어 다시 잡을 엄두도 안났습니다. 시즌제도 첨 접하는 거라, 새 시즌마다 새 캐릭터 키워야 하면 노가다가 너무 심하지 않냐는 걱정도 있었습니다.  하지만, 처음 해본 디아4의 시즌11은 상당히 만족스러웠습니다. 일단, 성장속도가 예전작들보다 정말 빨라서 쉽게 만렙을 찍을 수 있고(대략 20시간 정도면 만렙), 만렙 이후에 할 꺼리도 상당히 많으며, 난이도 조절도 캠페인 다시 깰 필요없이 게임 중에 조건만 맞추면 상향시킬 수 있고, 드랍율도 체감이 될 정도로 좋아서 레벨 오르면 순식간에 전설템으로 도배할 정도라 쾌적하게 육성할 수 있습니다. 거기다 전작의 개초딩 스토리 대신 호러스럽고 포스트 아포칼립스 스러운 분위기를 강조했는데, 이것도 취향에 꽤 잘 맞았습니다. 잡몹 수도 굉장히 많이 나와서 일대다로 쓸어버리는 재미도 있고, 패드 지원도 잘 되어 있어서 편한 자세로 패드잡고 시간 녹이기도 좋았습니다. 게임성만 따지면 지금까지 한 핵앤슬 중에서도 최상위권...  하지만, 오픈월드는 솔직히 없는게 낫지 않을까 싶을 정도로 무성의해서 별로였습니다. 오픈월드가 아닌 핵앤슬은 보통 맵에 맞춰서 몹이 자연스럽게 배치되고 등장하는 경우가 많습니다. 예를들어 특정 괴물들의 서식지를 지나면 해당 괴물종족들만 적으로 등장한다던가, 하늘을 나는 괴물들이 주인공이 지나가면 자연스럽게 근처에 착지해서 기습한다던가, 서로 적대적인 몹들끼리 주인공 놔두고 싸우는 등, 필드 기믹에 따라 다양한 연출을 볼 수 있었습니다. 하지만 디아4의 오픈월드 몹배치는 MMORPG의 것과 다르지 않습니다. 그냥 해당필드에 나오는 몹 적당히 섞어서 뭉텅이로 띄엄띄엄 배치한게 전부죠. 악마와 인간과 동물이 사이좋게 서로 모여서 주인공 기다리는거 보면, 몰입도 와장창 깨집니다. 그나마 던전에선 이런식의 무뇌배치가 별로 없지만, 필드 몹 배치 보면 고전 핵앤슬보다도 명백하게 퇴보한터라 한숨이 나옵니다.  BM으로 상당히 욕을 먹는 편인데, 저야 확팩1+확팩2 합본으로 사서 손해가 없었지만, 기존에 확팩1만 산 유저들은 빡치는게 이해가 갑니다. 하다못해  확팩2 단일 업그레이드 정도는 지원했어야 하는데, 대놓고 상술로 합본만 파는거보면 얘들이 얼마나 절박한지 느껴질 정도... 또, 게임 내에서 여러가지 꾸미기 아이템을 부분유료화로 파는데, 가격이 지나치게 비싸게 설정되어 있어 구매의욕을 와장창 무너트립니다. 개인적으로 페이투윈보다 꾸미기 아이템을 선호하는 편이고, 가격만 합리적이면 응원 차원에서도 어느정도 구매해주는 편인데, 의상 하나 가격이 어지간한 A급 게임 가격인거 보면 그돈씨 소리가 안 나올수가 없습니다. 가챠 넣은 핵앤슬보단 양심적이라 할 수 있지만, 가격이 너무 비싸고 세일기간에도 할인을 안해서 구매의욕이 일어나질 않습니다.  와이파이 환경에서 서버렉이 끔찍할 정도인데, 솔플을 해도 오픈월드에서 다른 유저들 움직이는거 보여주느라 데이터를 계속 주고받기 때문인지 수시로 끊깁니다. 말 타고 다니다보면 갑자기 수십미터 왔던길 워프하기도 하고, 전투 중에 갑자기 입력이 안 받으면서 모든 몹이 정지상태로 대기하다가 몇초 뒤에 파바박 움직이기도 하는 등, 솔플로도 정상적인 플레이가 힘들 정도로 심각합니다. 특히 세일기간에 유저들이 몰리는 시간에 접속하면 상상 이상으로 끔찍한 수준... 고행 이상 난이도에선 이거 때문에 죽는 경우도 많아서, 빡쳐서 광랜 설치 했지만, 와이파이 환경에서 게임하는 유저라면 구매하기 전에 주의가 필요합니다.  요약하자면 시즌제 핵앤슬 첫 입문작인데 성장 난이도도 낮고, 드랍율은 매우 높고, 전투하는 재미도 있으며, 컨텐츠량도 혜자라서 게임 내적으론 매우 만족스럽습니다. 하지만, 게임 외적으로 창렬한 BM이나 빡치는 서버렉 등 거슬리는 부분이 있다보니, 이런데 민감하다면 구매에 주의가 필요합니다.

不推荐！不推荐！不推荐！  一、购买过程（坑，要注意）  1.我2025年12月28日购买的《暗黑4》，想做为新年的游戏礼物，送给自己。  2.购买之后，我发现其中一些镜头和画面不适合我，我开始出现头晕、恶心、虚汗等状况；然后，我就想着能不能退款，哪怕是折价退款、或是更换其它同类游戏也行。  3.所以就发邮件申请退款，2026年1月2日我收到回复，“拒绝（refuse）”，因为我超过了他们规定的时限2小时（我玩了5h），只能在2小时（2h）内退款。试问一下，2小时对于一个游戏来说，哪怕是FC游戏，能玩多少场景？  4.但是条款里写的很清楚“可以适情况而定（是否退款）”，原话我忘了，但是有这么一条规定。我就想：呵呵，我上述的不良反应，可能还没有达到他们所谓的“情况”吧！太不人性了吧？几百RMB，算了！忍了！  二、不能单机（只有你们公司付出心血了？）  1.我发现退不掉游戏款，就只能自己玩，毕竟买了。但到今天（2026.01.14）大概20小时左右。每次上线，还必须连你们“暴雪官网”，不连就不能玩，中途离线也不能玩。我查了一下，官方回复，是怕盗版！！  2.连就连吧，我开加速器（这钱另付），打一个小boss，走1步，退3步，补血补不上，一下就被卡死！做为一个游戏玩家，被网络给卡死，是什么感觉，相信大家都深有体会！！你们没有那么强大的服务器，就不要支持那么多全球玩家好吗？  3.我就想问问设计者和你们公司，《星际2》就算了，时时对战；《暗黑4》完全可以单机，为什么不让单机？你们还怕被盗版？你以为就你们一个游戏公司？你以为你们的游戏有多好？  4.强调！只是一个游戏，好吧！你们防盗版，强制连线！让其他的游戏公司怎么想你们？就只有你们一个公司付出心血了？那么多游戏公司，是不是都要学你们强制连线？你这样考虑过玩家的感受吗？历史上倒闭的游戏公司还少吗？  三、针对游戏（乱、乱、乱）  1.《暗黑4》总体来说就是“乱、乱、乱”，我玩了不算时间长，就拿装备、武器之类的系统来说吧，乱就算了，还弄了个“升级树”，又是“树枝”，又是“树叶”的怎么？你想让一个猎魔人发展成德鲁依？或者还是一个法师，召唤2只骷髅？  2.还多了个不伦不类的马？还给马穿了装备？硬生生的弄成了“玄幻古装剧”？不知道是笑还是骂？没法评价！！！而且马的装备都得花钱，我装了一个免费的，设计者直接就给了个菜篮子，装在马屁股上！还不如就光突突什么也不穿呢！怎么？难道我打死了怪，还得给它们顺手撒点花？  3.继续乱，因为我现在已经找不到主线任务了，不像《暗黑3》有任务提示，全是赛季提示！一直都是在完成支线任务，或者是特定的赛季任务；就像是你被别人牵着鼻子走，就是不把你领进门，就是让你绕！你还开心的不骂人！  4.就说赛季任务吧，有一个魔王要塞的任务，我连续3天，每天转2小时左右，就发现了1个魔王要塞，但是任务要求是3个！！！哪里来的3个？我笨，满地图最大化找，地毯式搜索，我找不到，行了吧？我不做了！我也不玩了！  5.话说回来，主线都做不完，你还升巅峰？升巅峰有多大意义？必须得赛季、必须要支线，必须让你玩到边边角角？感觉这游戏直接就毁了！怎么？那么多好游戏，你们设计者，还想玩家指着这款游戏养老？  6.最坑的是，你说赛季就赛季吧，要完成第1章的赛季，有一个什么地下城钥匙的任务。我做了，做完了，但是不让你过，也还给你奖励！原因是，你必须得购买“憎恨之躯”，才能完成这个任务，不然你连第1章的任务都做不完！  7.第1章任务都做不完，后面还有23456，甚至更多，你怎么做？而且我发现第2章的任务已经有完成，但是打不开，只能先把第1章做完！这不是霸王条款吗？  四、总结（不推荐）  1.看好条款，多看评论，400RMB栽进去，值不值？  2.游戏的系统、设计、结构、组成，都乱，不如《暗黑3》！  3.捆绑销售，有2个角色你可以看见，但你必须先购买DLC；赛季你想完成，你也必须先购买DLC！  4.想玩完整的《暗黑4》，少说1000RMB，不加后续DLC，你先想值不值？  5.执意要玩《暗黑》，那么玩赛季选《暗黑3》、玩经典《暗黑2》！  PS：我不知道美国暴雪公司的人，能不能看到我的评论。我没有恶意，但是做为《暗黑》系列“骨灰级”玩家，我希望你们能多看看评论区，不要把这款游戏毁了好吗？

Сетевой режим ничем приятным не удивил, интересно прохождение с друзьями, но не более того. Самое главное сохранили дух диабло - мрачный, жуткий, разнообразный своим злом. Советую игру.

I find it extremely difficult to describe this game in any other words than a "rushed garbage". I truly do not believe any of the positive reviews are actual reviews not some bots - this game only deserves overwhelmingly negative feedback.  Bought it years after release to not encounter as many bugs and have some balance - found none of that. First thing I notice is a giant placeholder instead of a helmet because somebody forgot to check the textures. Then I get spammed with same notification for hours because apparently it has no trigger to stop it from appearing.   Stopped playing after every boss was dying on max difficulty just by holding a single button because, apparently, I started playing as a DLC pay-to-win class that is so overpowered it reduces all fights to nothing else than button holding (with spontaneous single click of other ability)...  This game has absolutely nothing in it to get me to keep playing. I am not even going to mention the ever-present, constant ads and brainwashing players into spending even more money on some worthless things.

Not the Diablo we all loved.  Boring.  They attempted to make the game look dark and brooding but it just looks generic and bland. It's way too easy, making coop even more boring and meaningless. One character can clear a mob so fast it's done in the blink of an eye. Perhaps it's different in the much much much harder difficulties but when you start the game on the hardest difficulty available you will not be fighting monsters cooperatively. One of you will push a button and everything will instantly die. The story is, I don't know what the story is. I get so bored with the yawn inducing expositions that I skip everything. The bosses and monsters have no flavor like they did in the previous games. It's just generic monster with a larger health bar that takes a few more button pushes to kill. The characters look cool. (except the Druid)

It's hard to say anything positive about Blizzard in recent years without losing a small piece of my soul. Diablo 4 has really shaped up though. I'd recommend anyone to jump into Hardcore, it is by far the most enjoyable and well-paced way to play the game. Do not read guides, listen to people on the internet or pay any attention to the meta. You will never be on the leaderboards or be rewarded for pushing arbitrary numbers. An obsession over the perfect build will likely ruin your enjoyment of the game, as it has for almost anyone who claims to enjoy this genre  Learn how the game works, and how all of its pieces and stats marry together. Craft your own builds based on class fantasies you enjoy. Everything can be built around and beat any meaningful content in the game. When you understand that the journey is the reward, you will finally have some measure of fun
