NO! NO! NO! NO!  *Why Players Say NO to Diablo 4 (Blizzard, take notes!)**  Casuals, hardcore grinders, and even the most insane endgame players — **no one stays here for long**, and many end up returning to **Diablo 3** instead of what you turned this legendary franchise into. ## **Let’s start with the good: visuals & atmosphere**  Atmosphere & sound — **7/10** Level design — **9/10** Graphics — **8/10** Story & lore consistency — **7/10** World & side quests — **6/10** Overall experience — **5/10**  Special shout-out to the **Lilith vs Inarius cinematic** — **999/10**. One of the best scenes not just in games, but in cinema. Nolan’s *Odyssey* doesn’t even come close.  Yet the final score of the game is **3/10**.  Surprised? You shouldn’t be. Here’s why.  ## **The core problem of Diablo 4: Blizzard killed the heart of the game** ### **1. Campaign difficulty restrictions are a complete failure** The world of Diablo 4 is beautiful, detailed, and filled with atmosphere and lore — but **you barely get to experience it**, because: * You get a **mount with sprint** early on, turning the world into something you just rush through instead of explore. * The game gives you no reason to engage with the environment — it becomes **a blurry background**. Even if you try to play slowly and do all quests, Blizzard already decided the outcome for you: > From levels **40 to 60**, everything dies in **one or two hits**, even on Veteran difficulty. That means **10+ hours** of clicking through enemies without tactics, danger, or challenge. That’s not gameplay — that’s **karaoke combat**.  ## **The numbers and the community agree** 📌 Diablo 4 lost **70–80% of its players** within the first **20–40 hours** 📌 Endgame concurrency is **3–4x lower than Diablo 3** at the same stage after launch 📌 Steam reviews show **65%+ negative feedback** due to repetition, lack of challenge, and boredom 📌 On forums and social platforms, **85% of players** describe the game as “too easy”, “unbalanced”, and “empty after the campaign”  ## **2. The difficulty system destroys all sense of challenge** The game locks real difficulty **behind campaign completion**. This is a design dead-end.  Blizzard, listen: > **Players must be able to raise difficulty whenever they want — not after a scripted checkpoint.** Almost **half of Diablo 4’s content feels pointless** because enemies pose no threat.  * Difficulty is **gated by progress**, not by player skill * Endgame becomes a mix of boring global events and repetitive dungeon spam * Even high-tier bosses die in **1–2 rotations**  That is not challenge — it is **the absence of it**. --- ## **3. Loot is meaningless and progression is fake** After finishing the campaign, my character jumped from **Torment 12 → 25 → 30** without any real build, optimization, or strategy.  The game **doesn’t demand competence** — it forgives everything: * Legendaries drop like rain * 95% of them are useless * You know all meaningful affixes before level 60  Loot is no longer exciting — it’s **just clutter**. ---  ## **Final verdict: Blizzard made something… but not a real game**  Diablo 4 fails: 👉 Casual players 👉 Hardcore players 👉 Endgame addicts 👉 Series veterans  It is a **hollow, shallow, beautifully wrapped disappointment**. --- ## **What Blizzard must do immediately** ⬆ Remove all **artificial difficulty gates** — let players increase it anytime ⬆ Rework **enemy behavior and scaling** — make them threatening again ⬆ Fix the **loot system** — rarity must mean value ⬆ Bring back **tactical depth and real risk**  Diablo was never meant to be a clicker. It was meant to be a brutal test of skill and strategy.  ## **And finally, Blizzard — wake the f*ck up!**  You spent 10,000 hours on story and cutscenes — and killed the game in the first 12. You built a world - and removed the reason to care.  You created lore - and deleted challenge.  Diablo 4 is not a step forward. It is a step **backward**.  If you want this franchise to be legendary again — start listening to **players, not marketing**.!
This game has its flaws, to be sure. But it's the ARPG that I keep coming back to.

[h1] Вступление [/h1] Повествование будет долгим, кто не любит много читать - лучше переходите в другой отзыв) Серия "Diablo" полюбилась мне еще в далёком 1996 году (или когда она там вышла?). Где-то на форумах "Diablo 3" читал хохмы о том, что средний возраст игроков около 40 лет и до выхода 4-ой части многие могут и не дожить xD А н-нет, дожили)  [h1] Часть 1. [/h1] Что мы получили... Кажется мы получили то, чего хотели все. Я не буду много разглагольствовать о "плюсах и минусах", т.к. отзыв пишется в 2026 году, а игра вышла в 2023, но есть некоторые вещи, которые я просто не могу обойти стороной. 1. Графика - она просто супер. То, что нравится именно мне. Особенно на "максималках". Выглядит просто шикарно! Сравнивал с ПоЕ2 - там графика мне показалась менее интересной. 2. Музыка - тут без комментариев, каждый, кто знаком с вселенной "Blizzard" понимает, что этим ребятишкам нет равных. Если взять великую троицу "Diablo", "StarCraft", "WarCraft" - поиграйте в любую из частей этих прекрасных игр и сами всё поймете. 3. Заставки, они же синематики - это еще одно направление, в котором Близзам нет равных. Весь ютуб завален видеороликами из игр "великой троицы" и собирает миллионы просмотров и лайков. Кино внедрено в игру, смотрите и наслаждайтесь.  [h1] Часть 2 [/h1] Я начал играть в эту прекрасную игру, только, в 2025 о чём сильно жалею. Жалею, что не прикоснулся к этому шедевру раньше. На то были свои причины и несколько лет я вообще в игры не играл, а когда вернулся в онлайн понял, что нужно искать своего фаворита. Я не люблю играть в несколько игр, мне нужно что-то одно, что будет скрашивать мой досуг вечерами или в выходные (на 1-3 часа, не более). Я плавно подвожу Вас к тому для кого эта игра точно подойдет, но зайду издалека. На сегодняшний день рынок цифровых развлекательных товаров переполнен. Сейчас работает очень много студий [i] от мАла до велИка [/i], которые занимаются разработкой игр. Время такое - интернет переполнен. Информация сыпется из каждого утюга. Говорить о играх можно бесконечно, при том сколько людей, столько и мнений. Если свести всё к личным интересам, то мне очень нравятся онлайн-RPG [strike] старичок WoW Vanilla 2006 г.в. перевернулся в гробу [/strike], но в силу обстоятельств я не могу играть в игры по 8-10 часов / день. В общем нужно что-то быстрое, где ты не тратишь много времени на рутинную прокачку персонажа, чтоб дойти до последней стадии игры и играть в удовольствие. Оно должно быть красочным, потому что я не готов тратить время на некачественную графику. Игра [u] обязательно [/u] должна быть на русском языке с русской текстовкой и озвучкой. С [b] качественным переводом [/b] - это помогает полностью погрузиться туда, куда мы уходим от реальности. [h3] Сюжет [/h3] - он обязателен. Без интересной истории не будет ощущения полноты проекта. Я люблю, когда игры напоминают кино. Тут этого придостаточно. Я уже много лет не испытывал такого кайфа от прохождения кампаний. Подводя итог смело заявляю. Если Вы - человек семейный и занятой, но у Вас есть 1-3 часа времени по вечерам - эта игра Вам идеально подойдет. Точно перезарядитесь эмоционально. Внедрение открытого мира - это, безусловно, верный шаг. Что уж говорить о том, что каждый сезон в проект вносятся корректировки и нововведения, которые кардинально меняют игру в лучшую сторону. Добавляется множество активностей и прочее. Про геймплей я ничего говорить не буду - сами всё знаете, а те кто не знает - узнаете и не пожалеете)  [h1] Часть 3 [/h1] Не обойду стороной и финансовый вопрос. Продукт получился качественный и не самый дешевый. Ежемесячной подписки нет. Купил и забыл. Понимаю, что положение у всех разное и для кого-то цена действительно может показаться неудобной. Тут всё познаётся только в сравнении. Для себя неудобств не вижу. Присутствует внутриигровой магазин, где можно приобрести экстерьер для своего персонажа - это приятно, кому надо - тот покупает. Система "Pay to Win" отсутствует. На январь 2026 года - игра продаётся в трёх частях (за каждую нужно платить отдельно): 1. Diablo IV - Vanilla; 2. DIV - Vessel of Hatred; 3. DIV - Lord of Hatred. Аналогичная ситуация была с вселенными "World of Warcraft" и "StarCraft II", где каждое дополнение продавалось отдельно. Я думаю, что тут ни для кого сюрпризов нет.  [h1] Заключение [/h1] Игра абсолютно точно стоит своих денег и времени, которое Вы на неё потратите. Если Вы фанат серии, а также изометрических Action RPG - не разочаруетесь. Что касается остальных - тут уж на усмотрение каждого) Спасибо за внимание!

if you enjoy the Diablo series for the hack and slash aspect, D4 improves upon D3 significantly; there's more to do at endgame, more levels of difficulty to push through, and the ability to customize/upgrade your gear lets you make ridiculously strong characters tailored exactly how you want to play them.  as for the story... well, it's often illogical, meandering, or nonsensical. the new characters, especially Neyrelle, often tank the plot, which is thin at best. i don't feel like Lorath or Donan provided enough of a counterpoint to Mephisto or Lilith, and i often found myself disagreeing completely with my character's opinions and actions.  i'm of the opinion that no one sufficiently proved that Lilith was the wrong answer. i found myself agreeing with Mephisto most of the time and rolling my eyes at the plotline, which essentially left us chasing an irrelevant bad guy over learning or understanding what's actually happening with Lilith.  of the diablo games i've played (2, 3, and 4), Lilith was the most underwhelming end boss.  in the end though, i'm a big, nearly invincible bear lady with poison smashy smashy, so it's still a fun game.

A weird ARPG. The story takes itself ultra seriously with these cinematic HBO cutscenes about how doomed the heroes are and how unstoppable the villains are, and then as soon as it's over you go into the next room and punch 100 skeletons into a million pieces each. The story routinely gets in the way of the gameplay and playing through the campaign is very stop and start. Someone coming from D2R or PoE would likely find this very jarring and want characters to just shut up and let you get on with it.  Powercreep hit this game hard. The game is extremely easy all the way up to Torment 1, but you can't play on that difficulty until you finish or skip the campaign. A lot of bosses I killed before they finished their monologues, skipped phases, etc. To call Lilith an underwhelming, anticlimactic final boss would be an extreme understatement. The proper way to play is probably to just skip the campaigns and focus on the season objectives and admittedly if you just play the game as if you were mapping in PoE, then it's pretty fun. This is effectively Diablo 3 with nicer models and less color at the end of the day, and it has all the same problems that game had so if you didn't like D3 you won't like this game.  It'd be easy to thumbs down this game because of Blizzard and the intrusive cosmetics shop and the story I didn't at all care for but it's really not a bad game. It's just kinda mid. If you can ignore all the flaws, and there's quite a few, the core gameplay is pretty mindless but fairly entertaining.  Edit: I forgot about the placeholder icons and the notification spam about a feature you unlocked 30 hours ago because Blizzard didn't do some basic QA. On second thought, yeah, thumbs down. I can't recommend this game in good conscience, the bad outweighs the good.

作为一款刷子游戏，第一，从玩法上来说，暗黑4玩法简单上手容易。很适合平常解压玩。差不多一星期，后面就枯燥乏味了些。总体是可以的。第二，从美术来说，那确实非常优秀，皮肤做的真心好看。设计不拘一格，且配色很是高大上，一点不LOW。 第三，从整体游戏服务体验来说，极差。也是我的玩后最终体验。 如果只从游玩来说，我不建议购买这一款游戏，即便他的优点很多。但是他有个大缺点实在另我寒心。 我的账号买过的游戏也不少，从未有过一款游戏如暗黑4叫我如此憋屈以及愤懑不惜给他写差评。 我的游戏号被封了。 我想很多人会觉得，这肯定是我做了坏事。比如外挂，比如复制门票。 但是这两条我都没有犯，被封号的当日，是S10赛季末了，大约晚上七点我正在玩深坑，带着个小号练级。因为电脑的配置和家里的网速，我开了两个号总是在传送中闪退，退的多了就不想玩了，于是晚上九点就下线了。第二天，我的大号就被封了，小号没事。大号是STEAM的号，小号是战网新买的d号。 S10赛季我才买的升级豪华包，就是给3000白金币那个。没有一个蠢人会在刚消费不久，就去触雷碰暴雪的底线去搞会被封号的事情。我自认为真没有。毕竟我的大小号一块都在玩。我的小号现在都没事。我真的从来不用外挂，也根本不会去复制门票。 那个赛季的门票，每张都是自己打的，也没有去买。 如果非要说到底因为什么违规，那么据我了解，有些人是购买了大量的复制门票超过200张，有的人是空交易装备或者金币，还有就是钻BUG的漏洞。 那么，如果是凭这几条要被封的话，那可以说，暴雪的玩家估计要封的快一个不剩了。 我们平常跟小伙伴交易，空交易多了去了，送装备送金币是常事，好些人至今没有被封。 至于BUG，更不用说了，自己挖的坑被别人踩了你还怪别人吗？当时我所知的唯一的漏洞就是那个刷地下室欧伯度石的漏洞，那刷这个的玩家也海了去了。 另外还有一个封号可能是故意挂机，恶意占用服务器资源。 我朋友跟我说，被封的大多数就是STEAM的玩家，战网的很少被误封，我们普通玩家不去碰外挂和复制票一般不会被封。他让我去申诉。 于是我傻乎乎得还很正经的去排查我的问题，把我认为的可能是暴雪误测的什么截图软件，后台内存清理软件等等，还有我总是传送掉线的问题，都写成英文，诚恳得叫他再给我排查一遍，我觉得我没有做任何破坏游戏环境和公平的坏事。 但是回信还是说我违规，也不说我违了哪一条规。 我朋友说，最终解释权在暴雪。那我想我放弃了。 我只是一个普通的玩家，也许我送过朋友装备，金币，这都属于空交易，那算我违规好像也对。有时候游戏没离线，下楼吃饭了，也算频繁挂机了，那也算我违规也可以。 都说STEAM可以换绑账号重新绑定玩，但是我不想了。 我难道还要再去仔细研究到底是犄角旮旯会触犯违规？ 真的太可笑了，不久之前我玩了一款别的游戏，我还特意去发帖吐槽那些用外挂的玩家。 没想到我这没用外挂，没用复制的，先被封掉了，还是才消费没多久。 太可笑了真的。 从未有过一款游戏让我如此厌恶与失望。  所以这便是我不推荐的理由。 这家游戏公司，觉得自己才是上帝，玩家是韭菜，要踩就踩，要割就割。 真是可惜了，这么好的美术。  但是没用啊，说没就没的游戏账号，你还愿意往里头充钱，或是去肝皮肤吗？ 普通玩家被误封的不是少数，以前我看那些被封的，发帖问的。总是被人喷，说什么自己干了什么自己不知道？ 当时我不以为然，我也这么觉得，直到我自己账号被封。 这是一个快餐游戏，不宜久留。  当然，如果是冲着搬砖去的。那么你看了我的文字，想来也不在乎头铁不铁。

✔️ Très fortement recommandé  Avec environ 35 heures de jeu, Diablo IV est tout simplement énorme.  Le contenu est colossal : une quantité de quêtes faramineuse, une map immense, et des saisons qui proposent du loot exclusif et permettent de jouer avec ses amis dans des conditions renouvelées. Même sans toucher aux saisons, le mode hors saison offre une difficulté extrêmes, dont la mort définitive qui peut mettre fin à des centaines d’heures de progression en un instant un vrai frisson pour les amateurs de risque.  Le jeu est aussi incroyablement profond et varié. Entre l’exploration, le loot, les donjons et les événements dynamiques, on a clairement l’impression de n’avoir effleuré que la surface du contenu disponible après 35 heures.  👉 Conclusion Diablo IV est un mastodonte du hack’n’slash, généreux, addictif et parfaitement conçu pour ceux qui aiment l’exploration, le loot et le défi. Un jeu immense, qui tiendra en haleine pendant des centaines d’heures.

26 heures de jeu, et plus aucune étincelle.  Diablo IV est beau, fluide… mais terriblement fade sur la durée. On passe plus de temps à comparer des +2% qu’à ressentir un vrai sentiment de progression ou de puissance.  Au final, tout est “correct”, mais rien n’est mémorable.  Pas de déclic, pas d’addiction, pas ce fameux “encore une heure”. Un jeu vidé de la magie qui faisait l’âme de la licence.

Играю с выхода первого ДЛС, нереально затягивает, не пропускал ни 1 сезона. Пробовал пое2 и эпоху на сотни часов, тоже понравились, но Д4 значительно интереснее.  Основные отличия для меня лично: 1) Крутая русская озвучка, сюжет и музыка топ. Ты понимаешь, что происходит в игре. Это сильно влияет на погружение. 2) Графика приятнее, чем у конкурентов. Скины в магазине невероятно красивые (хоть и дорогие) покупать, конечно, не буду, но позалипать иногда приятно. В гардеробе тоже куча топовых скинов, их мне хватает. 3) Нет никакого бесячего аукциона, я хочу сам выбивать шмот (играю в соло), ни разу ничего не покупал, только обменивался рунами. 4) Шмот для работы билда можно выбить за 1 вечер, и не нужно тратить десятки часов на фарм, чтоб получить шмотку, которая падает с ЛАСТ Босса, а до этого хз с чем рандомным бегаешь и ждешь этого момента, может и не дождёшься вовсе. 5) Классы сильно отличаются друг от друга, и способности соответствуют духу класса в отличие от пое2, где ты берёшь класс ради пассивки и играешь в конструктор. А то, что охотница бегает с посохом или другим не связанным с названием класса оружием, это прям зашквар и убивает суть рпг. 6) Тут не прилетают рандомные ваншоты как в эпохе, адекватный контроль выживаемости, не нужно кайтить обычных мобов. 7) Сезонные способности меняют билдострой, каждый раз интересно экспериментировать.

Dungeon and dragons, ролевой экшен, ролевая игра, все эти три тега (одни из самых важных были для меня при поиске во что поиграть) приписаны к диабло, однако не один не относиться к самой игре. Сами теги они подразумевают то, что в игре можно будет отыгрывать своего персонажа по своему. Но в игре дан просто линейный сюжет так ещё и не самый лучший. Не отыгровки своего класса/персонаж ничего такого нету, есть просто квесты и заранее приписанные фразы  которые отвечает твой персонаж без права выбора.  Сама боевка и система раскачки с лутом мне очень зашла, но весь прикол такой боевик пропадает когда сама игра очень лёгкая. Буквально компанию можно пройти без смертей практически не юзая зелья исцеления.  У игры есть множество прочих минусов\плюсов, но я назвал основные для меня моменты  Игра явно не стоит даже половине от её стоимости, так они ещё и длс выпускают по цене игры :)

S11赛季新入坑，创了一个灵巫开荒。目前巅峰230+秘境90层，玩的是手搓加特林，装备基本上接近毕业了吧。肝不动了来这吐槽一下。  本来想给个推荐的，但是两个难以忍受的缺点让我还是点了不推荐。  第一就是不少职业bd都太依赖“鼠标宏”了。一个刷子游戏，不能让玩家爽快地刷，反而还要去研究游戏之外的插件，这真的是非常失败的设计。我用手柄手搓加特林，为了按技能循环手都快搓骨折了，回头一看大秘境将将上90，别人装备不如我好的设置一套“鼠标宏”轻轻松松自动上120。当年用NS刷暗黑3的时候完全没有过这种感受。如果我想继续提升就只能换耙击BD，对于灵巫这个职业来说几乎没别的BD可选。  第二就是莉莉丝回响的BOSS战，打得我头皮发麻。这个BOSS战同时引入了两大令人深恶痛绝的机制，一个是锁血转阶段，另一个就是设置了大量的必杀招。管你输出多高，韧性多高。哎，打boss你是不可能秒得掉的，只有BOSS秒你的份~玩家等转阶段然后像个呆瓜一样地躲各种必杀技，稍微擦到了一点您就重新再来吧~必须给我老老实实背~板~ 暴雪的设计师现在就这水准了。

Diablo 4 simplesmente me pegou de um jeito que eu não esperava. Já passei das 106 horas de jogo e, sinceramente, cada minuto valeu a pena. A atmosfera sombria, a trilha sonora, a sensação de perigo constante e o cuidado nos detalhes fazem o mundo parecer vivo e pesado, como se cada passo realmente importasse.  O combate é viciante, a progressão do personagem dá aquela vontade de jogar “só mais um pouco”, e quando percebo, já se passaram horas. É o tipo de jogo que respeita quem gosta de se aprofundar, testar builds, explorar tudo com calma e curtir a jornada.  Não é só sobre derrotar inimigos ou pegar loot melhor — é sobre a experiência completa. Diablo 4 virou aquele jogo que eu sempre quero voltar, e essas 106 horas são só a prova de quanto eu realmente estou curtindo.

Из минусов отмечу - изредка баги, что квест не выполняется, или шмотка не принимает облик, который ты хочешь, хотя она у тебя висит в сумке, баги, связанные с кроссом, бывает не можешь вступить в группу пока не перезайдешь в игру. Ну по поводу цены - тут без комментариев, близы, этим всё сказано.  Но лучших бойцов с демонами ценой не испугать, а поэтому к плюсам : - Лор, даже с дополнением, контента хватает, кастсцены с собственным персонажем, и.т.п, однозначно от этого завораживает что-то внутри, жирный +++ .  - Визуальная составляющая, что скилов, что каких-то аур, все шикарно, красиво, радует глаз - Широкий эндгейм (личное мнение) , есть чем заняться после достижения максимального уровня  Как человек, мечтающий в своё время поиграть в Диабло 3, но по итогу спустя года приобревший это дополнение , очень доволен.  Игра отличная, мне кажется, я в ней залипну надолго, и что щас есть - это просто старт. Однозначно рекомендую всем, кто может это позволить без каких-то проблем, и кому нравится жанр.

I bought this forever ago on Battle.net and decided to come here for the convience. I left my initial playthrough after the first few season because Blizzard is just so greedy now it makes me sick. But I had friends who wanted to try it so I gave in. I was hoping after all this time maybe they got better.   They didn't.   This is the most shallow Diablo game when it comes to story by far. Even 1 was more engaging way back when. It held up in its era, this does not. Its 2026 and its just busy work disguised as achievement. I dont mind a grind, on the contrary, I like a grindy game. One thats rewarding. This is a big map, full of repetitive bloat.   The worst thing though is how money grubbing Blizzard got in sacrifice of quality. The earnable in game cosmetics are weak and depressing. If you want anything cool, its gonna cost half of what the game costs. The battle pass is expensive for very little reward. Its small, pricey, and low effort. The big stuff goes into purchasable packs.   If you want a dungeon crawler, play Path of Exile. At least even if they are microtransactiony, they still put work in their game and it has some depth. Blizzard should be ashamed of how they have taken a good name in gaming thats been around for decades and put out this disgusting show in avarice.

Diablo IV representa um retorno sólido e maduro da franquia às suas origens, combinando a atmosfera sombria clássica com sistemas modernos de jogabilidade. O jogo entrega uma experiência consistente, envolvente e altamente viciante para fãs de RPG de ação.  Jogabilidade e combate  O combate é um dos pontos mais fortes do jogo: fluido, responsivo e satisfatório. Cada classe possui identidade própria, com habilidades bem definidas e múltiplas possibilidades de builds, o que incentiva experimentação e replay. A progressão do personagem é clara e recompensadora, mantendo o jogador motivado ao longo de dezenas de horas.  Mundo aberto e exploração  Diferente dos títulos anteriores, Diablo IV aposta em um mundo aberto interconectado, com regiões variadas, eventos dinâmicos e atividades paralelas. Isso traz maior sensação de liberdade e torna a exploração mais orgânica, sem perder o ritmo característico da série.  Narrativa e atmosfera  A história é mais séria, sombria e bem conduzida, com destaque para a vilã Lilith, uma das antagonistas mais marcantes da franquia. A ambientação gótica, aliada à trilha sonora e ao design artístico, cria um clima denso e imersivo, reforçando a identidade de Diablo.  Conteúdo contínuo  O sistema de temporadas e atualizações frequentes garante longevidade ao jogo. Novas mecânicas, desafios e ajustes mantêm a experiência atualizada e relevante, tanto para jogadores casuais quanto para os mais dedicados ao endgame.  Aspectos técnicos  Visualmente, o jogo é muito bem acabado, com ótimo nível de detalhes, efeitos de iluminação e animações. O desempenho é estável na maioria das plataformas, contribuindo para uma experiência mais fluida e agradável.  Recomendação final  Diablo IV é altamente recomendado para quem gosta de RPGs de ação com foco em combate intenso, progressão constante e atmosfera sombria. É um jogo que agrada tanto veteranos da franquia quanto novos jogadores, oferecendo profundidade, variedade e alto valor de replay.  Se você procura um ARPG robusto, com identidade forte e suporte contínuo de conteúdo, Diablo IV é uma escolha segura e muito bem executada.

TLDR: If you intended to only do the story. Watch a youtube compilation instead. Or prepare to go out of your way to use bad gear if you're not speed running the story. Harder difficulties locked until campaign is finished, you outpace everyone's power very quickly.   Had no intentions to interact with the endgame, hoped to enjoy the story and avoid the minmax fest of number go up, do the same stages over and over again. However, Blizzard decided I'm not allowed to enjoy the campaign. Was in Act 2, blowing up major story bosses within seconds, 0 risk even if all I could use was left click. Upping the difficulty? Not an option until you finish the campaign. There are 6 Acts...   Until around lvl 40 every monster scaling with you seemed to work at a good pace, beyond that point the balance quickly falls apart. Screw me for engaging with side quests and familiarizing myself with the regions/cities/characters before jumping into the story bits. Great foes getting talked up, worries of impending doom and then I sneeze the Act boss away. That's Diablo IV if you don't speed run story chapters... Finishing the story means finishing the game to me. This ridiculous lock makes the game balance a joke and players are robbed of any challenge, as power levels don't line up at all with how the world seems to be portraying things.  If people up the difficulty too much and get blown up, that's their fault. If they succeed despite the odds, that should be celebrated. No option to go beyond Expert for the campaign serves no purpose, other than making the campaign a breeze. What's the point of difficulty options if you're given 3 flavors of trivial. Right now I feel robbed of a meaningful campaign experience. Looked up online, similar complaints commonplace, no signs of change. In fact there were methods to bypass the lock at lvl 60, which got patched out later. Blizzard double downing on this absurd limitation is unbelievable...  Had several side quests bug out, crucial triggers not happening. Most of those still possible to complete with roundabout and very time consuming solutions(e. x. quest mob only appearing at event zones, assuming you win the RNG of a specific event appearing). NPC's not appearing even after abandoning and restarting the quest, quest interactables not appearing, quest mobs not spawning, escorting NPC to a checkpoint doesn't make the quest progress. Over a year old forum posts, no fixes in sight.   Transmog only works sometimes. I recall trying the game until lvl 20 free weekend or something, that was some other season. The outfits I unlocked then aren't possible to transmog on my current season character. Scrapping the same design again doesn't fix it. So next season Transmog won't have majority of the options? That's the only explanation for it not working that made sense so far. Could be anything. As with most Diablo IV's issues, year old complaints, problems persist today. More pet peeves unmentioned, needless to say, waiting for the game to fix its issues doesn't apply with Blizzard games. They'll just pump out new expansions/seasons and ignore everything else.

This was my first time playing any game like this and I was surprised how much I enjoyed the game I couldnt get enough of it, unbeknownst to me though that there are seasonal wipes (which I had mistakenly joined right near the end of), this completely ruined my experience as I had levelled and partially geared up each kind of character which was a bit awkward at times.. Not sure if I will come back to this game unless there are some big updates.
As of 2026, it feels like the devs understood the task and are on the right path, so can recommend getting it on sale.

I really wanted to love this game. I put in real time. I played the story, going to the endgame, got uniques and even mythic gear, and genuinely felt invested in my character.  And that’s exactly where Diablo IV completely fails.  Diablo IV does not respect players who want a single long-term character. If you have a job, limited time, and care about meaningful progression, this game actively works against you.  Here’s the core problem: - Seasonal rewards are locked behind seasonal characters - Eternal characters are effectively second-class citizens - Every season, your seasonal character is pushed into Eternal and becomes irrelevant - Seasonal mechanics disappear instead of being meaningfully integrated - Balance and economy issues are handled by resetting players, not fixing exploits - This design clearly prioritizes grinders with unlimited time over players who play thoughtfully and consistently.  What makes this especially frustrating is the contradiction in design: The game gives you rare, emotionally binding loot (uniques, mythics) that feels like long-term progression — then tells you it’s only temporarily relevant. You’re encouraged to care, then punished for caring.  If you enjoy disposable characters, constant resets, and treating every season like a short-term experiment, you might be fine.  If you: - Have limited weekly playtime - Want one evolving main character - Care about story and progression - Expect your time investment to retain value  …this game will frustrate you.  Seasonal resets here don’t feel like meaningful content — they feel like a lazy workaround for balance and economy problems, disguised as tradition.  I didn’t quit because the game was hard. I quit because it made my time investment feel pointless.  That’s not difficulty. That’s disrespect for the player’s time.

I honestly think this game gets way too much hate. I’ve been with it since the PS5 launch, put in a solid 100 hours back then (so I definitely got my money's worth), but I fell off after Season 1. I decided to come back for Season 11 and I am genuinely having a blast.  The amount of Quality of Life (QoL) updates since launch is huge. It feels like a much more polished experience now.  Playing as the Paladin has been incredible. It’s exactly the kind of "Holy Warrior" gameplay the game was missing, and it feels great to play.  The updates to the endgame and how you progress your character feel much more rewarding than they did at launch.  I’m actually hyped for the Lord of Hatred expansion coming this April. From what they’ve shown so far, the new region of Skovos and the upcoming endgame overhauls look very promising. Plus, we’re getting the Horadric Cube back and a second mystery class!  If you haven't played since the early days, ignore the old reviews and give it another shot. It’s in the best state it’s ever been.

Diablo IV Review: A Game that lost its Vision  I firmly believe that behind every good game there is at least one person with a clear vision. This vision can be an addictive gameplay loop, a new groundbreaking idea or an emotional story. But what happens when a game during development changes this vision or comprises it to appeal to a wider audience? Well you get a game like Diablo 4. A game that can be fun at times but lacks the soul of the greatest.  Great lore meets a bland story  Diablo IV starts out with a very strong cutscene, followed by a great prologue. Without trying to explain all the details we are on the hunt for Lilith, a demon who is the mother of humans in the Diablo lore. The intro promises an exciting plot and fight between demons, angels and humanity. With a lot of grey areas in between.  Before playing I took some time to listen to some videos about the lore of Diablo and it honestly made me excited to play the game. The core premise is great and that humanity is the result of an unholy child of an angel and a demon gives potential for great story telling. Because of that I was excited during the prologue and act 1 of Diablo 4. Following Lilith's first steps gave me hope for an epic adventure, sadly that hope didn't get fulfilled.  What follows after act 1 honestly can only be described as lazy and uninspired writing, meets a way too long game for its thin story. You will meet characters you will mostly not care about who send you from A to B to C and back to A and repeat. Sadly the game shows here clearly that the story is only there to serve as backdrop for its gameplay.  Only in the last act it gets somewhat exciting again with epic cutscenes and a decent twist. But it's simply not enough. The first expansion Vessel of Hatred only makes things worse. In some ways Diablo 4's story feels like someone asks Chatgpt for an exciting start and end for a story but then puts in no effort to fill the blanks in between.  Where the Vision got lost  Now let's talk about the most important part of Diablo 4, the gameplay. To get the basics out of the way. The core gameplay feel is great. The way your character moves, the animations of your skills, how much impact you have on your enemies. Diablo 4 feels good and smooth to play. But as soon as you start to look deeper the problems start to occur.  When Diablo 4 was in the beta the game felt very different. It was much slower and more tactical. You couldn't just make the whole screen explode but had to approach enemies with a bit of respect. To me it's clear that this was the basic vision of the devs.  In my eyes this approach would have worked great with many of the systems Diablo 4 included at launch. For example the game offers a huge open world, with many hidden dungeons. Those dungeons often reward you with new passive skills that can change the way you play the game. This could have felt amazing if those dungeons would be difficult and the skills would feel earned.  Sadly someone at Blizzard must have gotten cold feet before launch and already nerfed down the enemies to make the game a lot easier. Over the years this trend just continued. If you play the campaign in 2026 its balance is honestly not existing. No matter what spec you use, no matter if you take care of your items, no matter what skills you use, everything will die without any effort.  This lack of any sort of challenge makes the campaign often feel like simple busy work. You're discouraged from exploring the world, or from doing anything side quests because why would you? To become even more overpowered? Why care about item drops when you anyways kill everything just by looking at it?  To me the best games are those who follow a clear vision with only little or none compromise. One of the best examples of this was the fantastic Hollow Knight Silksong last year. No this doesn't mean that it's not ok to make an easy game. But if you do, you need to design the whole game around it.  If Diablo 4's campaign wants to be an easy breeze to play through they should have designed it that way. Make it shorter and include more memorable moments to the story. Maybe even add some little gameplay twists here and there to keep it fresh.   Look at Nintendo games like Mario or Kirby. Most of those titles are easy but they keep on introducing new ideas to keep the gameplay fresh and exciting. Diablo 4 on the other hand plays the same after 2 hours as it does after 40 hours. The game does offer many systems for crafting and tweaking your characters but none of these are needed in any shape or form for the campaign.  Is Diablo IV fun?  At this point it should be clear the campaign of Diablo 4 is mid at best. It has a few exciting moments but overall it's just too bland. To many of the same environments, to little gameplay ideas and simply no guts to create a game with a vision.  All that said, yes Diablo IV is still fun. In the end the core of the game is its seasonal gameplay. Every few months releases a new season, with new features (more or less). The simple gameplay loop of creating a new character, leveling to max level and hunting for new loot is fun at its core. Compared to other games like Path of Exile, Diablo 4 does lack depth.  The game has less build choices and is in general easier to play. Still this is in general not a bad thing. To me Diablo 4 is like fast food for your mind. It gives you a fun time after a long day at work. It doesn't force you to make hard decisions and simply rewards you for being there and playing, while giving you new goals to strive for. But just like with fast food you won't be thinking about it afterwards and raving about how good this hamburger from mc donalds was.  Not every game has to be complex and overall I'm fine with Diablo wanting to be the casual ARPG. My main problem is that the game clearly was intended to be something else. This new Diablo 4 was built on the vision of the old one and its graveyards are still everywhere to see and remind you of what this game actually wanted to be.  Rating: Worth a Try  The review is originally from my website: https://kasurgaming.com/diablo-iv-review/

After completing the Main Game, and the Vessel of Hatred expansion, as a Spiritborn, along with the vast majority of the side quests, I am confident enough to give Diablo IV a positive rating. But buy it on sale, regardless.  So how is the game?  It’s good. Even very good much of the time.  Act 1 hits you like a freight train with an authentically bleak, winter hellscape. Great music. Great art design, and surprisingly strong writing. The latter is a major step up from the hamfisted cliché fest that was Diablo 3’s ridiculous story. It’s (almost) flawless in its execution.  The worldbuilding is fantastic with a lot of callbacks to previous games but also builds its own narrative without constantly relying on nostalgia.  The main quest is intriguing enough, with a lot of twists and turns, and a consistent tone of hope in the face of ever more dire and desperate stakes.  Beyond Act 1, it does start to lose some of its pacing and intrigue, unfortunately, as the story grows messier and more rushed.  Thankfully, the sidequests retain much of that interest as they really flesh out the main game’s bleak, but persevering tone. I actively tried to seek out blue exclamation marks wherever possible.   As a spiritborn, I found the gameplay satisfying. The movement and attacks feel great, and the game gives you a lot to do. The open world is worth exploring and unlocking strongholds and fulfilling objectives does tend to provide fairly meaningful rewards. Or at least, offers the chance for more sidequests.  It’s a casual experience, but as a casual player these days, it does the job.  It’s a very good game in the end…  But…there is a major thorn in this game’s side that keeps it from being great, at least narrative-wise.  Remember how I said Act 1 was (almost) flawless?  Neyrelle.  The moment that awkward, and almost out of place, cutscene introduced her, I groaned “Oh no, we’re gonna be spending the rest of the game with her, aren’t we?”  Luckily, it was wasn’t all of the game, but when she is the focus, the whole narrative takes a downturn. People start making dumb decisions and dumb things start to happen when she’s around.  I get why she exists: To provide a continuous emotional stake to the circumstances. But she is a horribly written and completely unsympathetic character. Who just makes things worse in the end    The final decision she makes at the end will go down as one of the dumbest ‘good intentions’ any character as ever made. When the Devil is making more sense and comes off as more trustworthy, you know you messed up badly with your story.   I’ll expand upon this in my Vessel of Hatred review, but suffice it to say, making her the center of that expansion was a narrative disaster.   At least Diablo 3 at the courtesy of killing off Leah (a similarly unsympathetic, though not as annoying, character), but here, the character we’re forced to feel sorry for, sticks around.     But the sum of Diablo IV’s parts more than makes up for its late game stumbles.

Diablo 4 fühlt sich für mich einfach nicht nach dem Diablo an, über das man in ein paar Jahren noch positiv sprechen wird. Unterm Strich: Für mich hat Diablo 4 seinen eigenen Stil, aber es trifft nicht das, was ich an Diablo liebe.

Diablo 4, at this point, is much better than it was at launch, but still far from perfect.  The game promised an open world, visceral combat, and endless loot, and a lot of the time it delivers on that. Other times, it just makes you want to slap Blizzard across the face.   📜 The beginning of my experience: I played at a slow pace, with no rush to reach the endgame, and the first thing that stood out was the weight of the world. Not in an overdone “dark fantasy” way, but in a sense of exhaustion.  Sanctuary feels like a place where nothing worked out, where people no longer expect salvation. And that works. The story doesn’t try to impress you every second. It walks alongside you.  Lilith, in particular, isn’t a villain who screams evil. She questions, provokes, and sometimes makes way too much sense. More than once, I found myself more uncomfortable with the so-called “heroes” than with her.   🍺 My overall take: Diablo 4 today is a functional, solid game that finally aligns with what it promised, but it still carries questionable Blizzard decisions that feel like they were made by a committee, not by people who actually play.  It delivers good combat, a heavy atmosphere, and addictive progression, as long as you accept that part of your time will be spent running recycled content in exchange for loot that’s almost good.  The expansion improves pacing, adds real build options, and the Paladin comes in as a well-designed class, not a band-aid fix. Even so, the game suffers from the same old issue. Once the new content runs out, it becomes clear the endgame still needs more purpose than just “making numbers go up for no real reason.”  If you like the style, you’ll have fun. If you’re expecting something revolutionary, you’ll eventually realize this is controlled evolution, not bold ambition.

I'm a very casual player but I've enjoyed this far more than Diablo 3 which simply got boring after a while. The scenery and monster design is gorgeous: I frequently catch myself just stopping for a bit to look at everything (I seriously want a map maker so that I can make visual handouts for my D&D campaign). The game play is fast and crazy, but it's easy to change your playstyle instantly via respeccing. Like any other game of this genre, it gets repetitive, but the promise of new cosmetic items is always pulling me back it, which is quite silly in retrospect but whatever, I've been having fun so far. A bit pricey, but no regrets yet. I like that the only in-game store items are just cosmetics; no "pay to win" structure here at all. Fun for casuals, I can't comment on the viability of "serious" play.
